tun: <entryFree id="n49419" type="main" key="tu_n'"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tūn'</orth> = tune, v. tu.</entryFree>
tunc: <entryFree id="n49420" type="main" key="tunc"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tunc</orth>, <sense id="n49420.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adv. demonstr.</hi>, of time [tum, and <hi rend="ital">demonstr.</hi> suffix -ce], <hi rend="ital">then</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at that time;</hi> but in ante-class. and class. prose tunc is always emphatic, and generally refers to a point of time. In post-Aug. style tunc freq. occurs without emphasis, and is freely used of periods of time. Tunc = deinde occurs first in the class. per. and rarely in prose; but is very freq. after the Aug. per. Tunc in mere co-ordinative use is very rare and not ante-class. (v. I. C.). Tunc coupled with an emphatic or temporal particle is very rare in class. prose, but freq. in the postAug. period. Poets often use tunc instead of tum before vowels for the sake of the metre. In general, tunc is not freq. till after the Aug. period. Cic. has tum about thirty times as often as tunc; Cæs. has tunc only five times; Livy, in the first two books, has tunc five times, tum eighty-two times; but Val. Max. has tunc four times as often as tum. Sen. almost always has tunc; tum only in a few passages, mostly in co ordinative use. In Vitr., Suet., Plin., Just., and the jurists, tunc largely predominates; but Nep. has tunc once only, and Tac., who employs both words sparingly, has tum oftener than tunc. The Codd. very freq. vary between the words, and in many passages the reading is still doubtful. Undue weight has been given by some critics to opposition to nunc and connection with cum; cf. Kritz ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 5, 1</bibl>; Zumpt ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:64:section=142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 64, § 142</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 5, 10, § 27</bibl>. Both tum and tunc are freq. opposed to nunc, and connected with cum. </sense><sense id="n49420.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg> </sense><sense id="n49420.2" n="A" level="2"> Referring an event to a time before mentioned. </sense><sense id="n49420.3" n="1" level="3"> To definite past time. </sense><sense id="n49420.4" n="(a)" level="5"> To a period of time, = illis temporibus (only post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">tunc melius tenuere fidem cum paupere cultu Stabat in exiguā ligneus aede deus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:10:19" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 10, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nulli tunc subsessores alienorum matrimoniorum oculi metuebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:1:5" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed tunc clarissimus quisque juvenum pro amplificandā patriā plurimum periculi sustinebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:2:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc quo ventum est? A servis vix impetrari potest ne eam supellectilem fastidiant quā tunc consul non erubuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:3:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo pacto inter amicos viguisse tunc justitiam credimus, cum inter accusatores quoque, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:5:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 5, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si vere aestimare Macedonas qui tunc erant volumus, fatebimur, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:16:33" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 16, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed civitati nullae tunc leges erant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:7:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 7, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:6:9:5" default="NO">6, 9, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49420.5" n="(b)" level="5"> Referring to a point of time spoken of: cives Romani <pb n="1914" /> <cb n="TUNC" /> tunc facti sunt Campani, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Censor.</author> 14</bibl> (Ann. v. 174 Vahl.): tanto sublatae sunt Augmine tunc lapides, id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 211, 8</bibl> (Ann. v. 542 ib.): tunc ipsos adoriant, ne quis Spartam referat nuntium, Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 8, p. 801</bibl> P. (Trag. Rel. v. 16 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">(Sulla) statim ex iis rebus quas tunc vendebat jussit ei praemium tribui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:10:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Arch. 10, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque ego tunc princeps ad salutem esse potuissem si, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">his tunc cognitis rebus amici regis his ... liberaliter responderunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tunc duces Nerviorum ... colloqui sese velle dicunt,</quote> <trans><tr>at this time</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 5, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod se facturos minabantur, aegreque tunc sunt retenti quin oppidum irrumperent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 2, 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romanus tunc exercitus in agro Larinati erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:24:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 24, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">itaque cum in ipsum, et innocentiā tutum et magistratu in quo tunc erat, impetus fieri non posset, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:44:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 44, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 2, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 8, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:37:10" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 37, 10</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">44, 44, 3: nec, si rescindere posses (sc. jussa Jovis), Tunc aderas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:679" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 679</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tunc ego nec citharā poteram gaudere sonorā, nec, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:4:69" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 4, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tunc urbis custodiis praepositus C. Maecenas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:88:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 88, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">forte evenit ut tunc summae dignitatis ibi femina veneno consumere se destinarit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:6:8" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 6, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui tunc Libitinam exercebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:2:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Coriolanus ad Volscos, infestos tunc Romanis, confugit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:4:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 4, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:10:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 10, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:8:5" default="NO">4, 8, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:5:3" default="NO">5, 5, 3</bibl>; 7, 6, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <cit><quote lang="la">8, 1 damn. 1: Carthaginiensium legati ad celebrandum sacrum anniversarium more patrio tunc venerant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:2:10" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et tunc aestas erat, cujus calor, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:5:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perierat imperium, quod tunc in extremo stabat, si Fabius, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Troad. 1:11:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Troad. 1, 11, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tunc,distractis Orientis viribus, casus Mithridati datus est occupandi Armeniam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 9</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quidam ex eis qui tunc egerant, decesserunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:24:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 24, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ardente tunc in Africā bello,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:70" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 70</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:48" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 20</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Asiam tunc tenebat imperio rex Darius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:9:20" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 9, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostes tunc populi Romani fuerant Fidenates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:21:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 17, 21, 17</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:5:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 13, 5, 2</bibl> and 3; 14, 1, 8; Ael. <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Had. 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">23</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">24</bibl>.—Repeated by anaphora: <cit><quote lang="la">tunc victus abiere feri, tunc consita pomus, tunc bibit inriguas fertilis hortus aquas, Aurea tunc pressos, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:1:43" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 1, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tunc Parmenio et Philotas, tunc Amyntas consobrinus, tunc noverca fratresque interfecti, tunc Attalus, Eurylochus ... occurrebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:6:14" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 12, 6, 14</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:3:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 43, 3, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:4:2" default="NO">43, 4, 2</bibl>.—Attributively: <cit><quote lang="la">regem tunc Lacedaemoniorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:6:2:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 6, 2, 4</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n49420.6" n="(g)" level="5"> Referring to a state no longer in existence: <cit><quote lang="la">silvae tunc circa viam erant, plerisque incultis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:25:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 25, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbs (Corinthus) erat tunc praeclara ante excidium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:28:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 45, 28, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic (Curio) primo pro Pompei partibus, id est, ut tunc habebatur, pro republicā, mox ... pro Caesare stetit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:48:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 48, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">certissimum tunc proscriptorum perfugium penetravit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:7:3:9" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 7, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">docuit in atrio Catulinae domus, quae pars Palatii tunc erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:17" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gram. 17</bibl></cit>: tunc (i. e. olim) in usu erat, eam hereditatem, etc., Gai <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 2, 254</bibl> erat autem tunc mos ut cum princeps causam cognosceret ... sententiam ex omnium deliberatione proferret, Ael. <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Had. 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49420.7" n="(d)" level="5"> Expressly opposed to present time: tunc igitur pelles, nunc aurum et purpura exercent hominum vitam, Lucr 5, 1423; <cit><quote lang="la">eā lege quae tunc erat Sempronia, nunc est Cornelia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:56:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 56, 154</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum vero causam justam deus ipse dederit, ut tunc Socrati, nunc Catoni, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:30:74" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 30, 74</bibl></cit>, cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:18:section=45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 18, § 45</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 3, 67, § 156</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Arch. 3, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:13:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 13, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:12:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Post. 12, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:7:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 7, 5, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cur privati non damus remiges, sicut tunc dedimus?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:6:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 6, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">munitiones et locis opportunioribus tunc fuerunt et validiores impositae (i. e. quam nunc),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:17:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 17, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parva nunc res videri potest quae tunc patres ac plebem accendit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:25:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 25, 13</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:31:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 31, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:18:5" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 18, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Macedones milites eā tunc erant famā quā nunc Romani feruntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 3, 4</bibl></cit>: nunc solvo poenas; <cit><quote lang="la">tunc tibi inferias dedi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Phoen. 172" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Phoen. 172</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc haberent socios quos tunc hostes habuerant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:6:7:5" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 6, 7, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:2:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 2, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc tunc Veii fuere, nunc fuisse quis meminit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:12:11" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 12, 11</bibl></cit>.—And tunc and tum in co-ordinated sentences: qui ager nunc multo pluris est quam tunc fuit. Tum enim, etc., nunc, etc.; <cit><quote lang="la">tum erat ager incultus, nunc est cultissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:12:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 12, 33</bibl></cit>: vos etiamsi tunc faciendum <cb n="TUNC" /> non fuerit, nunc utique faciendum putatis; <cit><quote lang="la">ego contra, etiamsi tum migrandum fuisset, nunc has ruipas relinquendas non censerem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:53:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 53, 3</bibl></cit> (in such connections tum generally refers to a previous tunc, rarely vice versā).—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) Opposed to a previous or a later time: <cit><quote lang="la">quae ipsum Hannibalem, armis tunc invictum voluptate vicit (i. e. etsi non postea),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:35:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 35, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">raro alias tribuni popularis oratio acceptior plebi quam tunc severissimi consulis fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:69:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 69, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Syphax) tunc accessio Punici belli fuerat, sicut Gentius Macedonici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 45, 7, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:37:2" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 37, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:25:10" default="NO" valid="yes">45, 25, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non ab Scipionibus aliisque veteribus Romanorum ducum quidquam ausum fortius quam tunc a Caesare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:80:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 80, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et tunc Aeanti, ut deo, immolaverunt, et deinceps, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:5" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 5</bibl></cit>, ext. 2: <cit><quote lang="la">praetor hic Alexandri fuerat, tunc transfuga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:11:18" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 11, 18</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:13:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 13, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cilicum nationes saepe et alias commotae, tunc Troxoboro duce, montes asperos castris cepere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 55</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 58</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ob res et tunc in Africā, et olim in Germaniā gestas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:8" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 8</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Oth. 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">idem tunc Faesulae quod Carrhae nuper,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:5:8" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 5, 8</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) In general statements, applied to the actual state of affairs: <cit><quote lang="la">mos est regibus quotiens in societatem coëant, pollices inter se vincire, etc. Sed tunc, qui ea vincula admovebat decidisse simulans, genua Mithridatis invadit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legebatur ergo ibi tunc in carmine Latino, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:22:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 22, 2</bibl></cit>.— Pregn., <hi rend="ital">as matters then stood</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aptissimum tempus fuerat, delinimentum animis Bolani agri divisionem obici: tunc haec ipsa indignitas angebat animos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:51:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 51, 6</bibl></cit>.— (<foreign lang="greek">h</foreign>) Of coincidence in time: tunc = cum hoc fieret, <hi rend="ital">on that occasion</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quodsi tu tunc, Crasse, dixisses, omnem eorum importunitatem evellisset oratio tua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:53:230" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 53, 230</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:56:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 56, 153</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:5:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Lig. 5, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:7:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 7, 5, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tunc Lacedaemoniis accusantibus respondendum erat, nunc a vobis ipsis accusati sumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:36:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 36, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam Horatius secundam pugnam petebat. Tunc ... clamore adjuvant militem suum,</quote> <trans><tr>while he was doing so</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:25:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 25, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:23:17" default="NO" valid="yes">45, 23, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed neque ... nubes Tunc habuit, nec ... imbres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:310" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 310</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid mihi tunc animi fuit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:7:582" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 582</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid mihi tunc animi credis, germane, fuisse?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:11:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 11, 87</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">12, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid tunc homines timuerint, quae senatūs trepidatio ... neque mihi exprimere vacat, neque, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:124:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 124, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non Catoni tunc praetura, sed praeturae Cato negatus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:7:5:6" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 7, 5, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:8:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 8, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:5:3" default="NO">4, 5, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:1:8" default="NO">6, 1, 8</bibl>; 6, 2, 3; 6, 2, 6; 6, 6, ext. 1; <cit><quote lang="la">9, 3, 1: tunc ego dicere debui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 63:15" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 63, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non possum dicere aliud tunc mihi quam deos adfuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 5, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tunc domus priscorum ducum arserunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:38" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 38</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:18:3:14" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 18, 3, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6</bibl> (7), 3, 48; 12, 13, 21; 19, 1, 11.—Tunc and tum co-ordinate: sanguine tunc (Phaëthontis) credunt ... Tum facta'st Libya ... arida; <cit><quote lang="la">tum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:235" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 235</bibl></cit> sqq.: tunc ... sorores Debuerant, etc.; <cit><quote lang="la">Tum potui Medea mori bene,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 12, 3</bibl></cit> sqq.—And referring to a supposed action at a definite time: <cit><quote lang="la">nobis tunc repente trepidandum in acie instruenda erat,</quote> <trans><tr>if we had accepted the battle then</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:38:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 38, 11</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">q</foreign>) Redundant (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">id quale fuerit, neque ipse tunc prodidit, neque cuiquam facile succurrat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tit. 10</bibl></cit>; cf.: in ejusmodi temporibus tunc eae ambulationes aperiuntur, Vitr 5, 9, 9.—</sense><sense id="n49420.8" n="2" level="3"> = nunc, in oblique discourse (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">quod si consulatūs tanta dulcedo sit, jam tunc ita in animum inducant, consulatum captum a tribuniciā potestate esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:54:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 54, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut cum multis saeculis murus urbi civium virtus fuerit, tunc cives salvos se fore non existimaverint nisi intra muros laterent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:14:5:7" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 14, 5, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49420.9" n="3" level="3"> Referring to indefinite time. </sense><sense id="n49420.10" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Then</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at such a time of the year</hi>, <hi rend="ital">day</hi>, etc.; <hi rend="ital">at such a season</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tunc (i. e. autumno) praecidi arbores oportere secundum terram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:27" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab eo in fastis dies hordicalia nominantur, quod tunc hordae boves immolantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 2:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes (nubes sol) enim sub se tunc (= medio die),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 1:8:7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 1, 8, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tunc enim maximae et integrae adhuc nives (= aestate primā),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 4:2:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 2, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et tunc potest ventis concitari mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 4:2:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 2, 25</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 4:5:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 5, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49420.11" n="(b)" level="5"> With the force of an indefinite temporal clause: <cit><quote lang="la">tunc ignes tenuissimi iter exile designant et caelo producunt, of shooting stars,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 1:1:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 1, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cb n="TUNC" /> nemo observat lunam nisi laborantem. Tunc urbes conclamant, tunc pro se quisque superstitione vanā trepidat, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 7:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 1, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">adjuvari se tunc (i. e. cum faces vident) periclitantes existimant Pollucis et Castoris numine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 1:1:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1, 13</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 1:8:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 8, 3</bibl>; 2, 55, 2; 5, 3, 1; 6, 12, 2; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 42:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 42, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Brev. Vit. 11:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brev. Vit. 11, 1</bibl>: si ancilla ex cive Romand conceperit, deinde civis Romana facta sit, et tunc pariat, etc., Gai <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 1, 88</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 90</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:6:8" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 6, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:40:12:22:section=3" default="NO">40, 12, 22, § 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49420.12" n="(g)" level="5"> With the force of a conditional clause, <hi rend="ital">in this instance: Tr.</hi> Erus peregre venit. <hi rend="ital">Si.</hi> Tunc tibi actutum chorda tenditur, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 2, 55</bibl> Lorenz (al. tum): <cit><quote lang="la">dominae mentem convertite ... Tunc ego crediderim vobis, et sidera et amnes Posse, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:1:23" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 1, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">itaque tunc dividere optimum erit (= si plura sunt quae nocent),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:101" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 101</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 1, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cuperem tecum communicare tam subitam mutationem mei: tunc amicitiae nostrae certiorem fiduciam habere coepissem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 6:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 6, 2</bibl></cit>: nemo est ex inprudentibus qui reliqui sibi debeat. Tunc mala consilia agitant, tunc aut aliis aut ipsis pericula struunt; <cit><quote lang="la">tunc cupiditates improbas ordinant, tunc ... tunc ... denique, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 10:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 2</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">7, 2: tunc enim (i. e. si cottidie reputes) subit recordatio: Quot dies quam frigidis rebus absumpsi!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 9, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propter liberos retentio fit (dotis) si culpa mulieris divortium factum sit, tunc enim sextae retinentur ex dote,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ulp.</author> Fragm. 6, 10</bibl></cit>: veluti si a feminā manumissa sit: tunc enim e lege Atiliā petere debet tutorem, Gai <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 1, 195</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 76</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 40</bibl>; 3, 181; Fragm. Vat. 52; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:4:8" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 2, 4, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:3:13:section=12" default="NO">5, 3, 13, § 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:3:1" default="NO">7, 3, 1</bibl>; 19, 1, 11, § 15; 11, 1, 20; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst. 1:12:section=6" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. 1, 12, § 6</bibl>; in the jurists, saep.—</sense><sense id="n49420.13" n="4" level="3"> Referring to future time. </sense><sense id="n49420.14" n="(a)" level="5"> In gen.: tunc illud vexillum ... coloniae Capuae inferetur; <cit><quote lang="la">tunc contra hanc Romam illa altera Roma quaeretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:32:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 32, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tunc, ut quaeque causa crit statuetis, nunc libertatem repeti satis est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:53:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 53, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatūs consultum adjectum est ut ... praetor qui tunc esset ... apud eorum quem qui manumitteretur ... jusjurandum daret, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:9:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 41, 9, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec taedebit avum parvo advigilare nepoti ... Tunc operata deo pubes discumbet in herbā, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:5:95" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 5, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tunc interea tempus exercitūs ex hoc loco educendi habebis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:7:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 7, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49420.15" n="(b)" level="5"> With the force of a conditional clause: <cit><quote lang="la">tunc me biremis Tutum ... Aura feret geminusque Pollux (i. e. si mugiat malus procellis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:29:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 29, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vectabor umeris tunc ego inimicis eques (i. e. si hoc feceris),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:17:74" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 17, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tunc tua me infortunia laedent (i. e. si dolebis tibi),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tunc ego jurabo quaevis tibi numina ... Tunc ego ... Efficiam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 15</bibl></cit> (16), 319: <cit><quote lang="la">tunc piger ad nandum, tunc ego cautus ero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 17</bibl></cit> (18), 210.—</sense><sense id="n49420.16" n="B" level="2"> Representing sequence or succession in events, = deinde. </sense><sense id="n49420.17" n="1" level="3"> Simple sequence in time. </sense><sense id="n49420.18" n="(a)" level="5"> Time proper (rare till after the Aug. per.; <cit><quote lang="la">in Cic. perh. only in the foll. passages): Herodotus cum Romā reverteretur, offendit eum mensem qui sequitur mensem comitialem. Tunc Cephaloeditani decrerunt intercalarium XLV dies longum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:52:section=130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 52, § 130</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veni in eum sermonem ut docerem, etc. Tunc mihi ille dixit quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dixi ei, me ita facturum esse ut, etc. Tunc ille a me petivit, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 6, 2</bibl></cit> is finis pugnae equestris fuit. Tunc adorti peditum aciem, nuntios ad consules rei gestae mittunt, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:70:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 70, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tandem curiā excesserunt. Tunc sententiae interrogari coeptae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:25:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 45, 25, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equites, relictis equis, provolant ante signa ... Tunc inter priores duorum populorum res geritur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iterum deinde interpellatus, in proposito persistit. Tunc Poppedius, abjecturum inde se ... minatus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:1:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:4:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 4, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:7:3:2" default="NO">7, 3, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:7:3:6" default="NO">7, 3, 6</bibl>: tunc intendit arcum, et ipsum cor adulescentis figit, Sen. de Ira, 3, 14, 2; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:Ot. Sap. 1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ot. Sap. 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:Q. N. 1:12:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Q. N. 1, 12, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Dareum XXX inde stadia abesse praemissi indicabant. Tunc consistere agmen jubet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:8:24" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 8, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contionem discedere in manipulos jubet. Tunc a veneratione Augusti orsus flexit ad victorias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 34</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 67</bibl>; 12, 31; 12, 33; 12, 69; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 72</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 4, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:6:7" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 6, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 1, 2</bibl>; 2, 1, 4; 5, 12, 5; 7, praef. 5; 7, 1, 3; 7, 2, 2; 8, 1, 1; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:49" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vit. 15 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Dom. 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 2:5:4" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 2, 5, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:22:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 22, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6" default="NO">6</bibl> (7), 17, 6; 13, 31 (30), 6; 14, 2, 9; <pb n="1915" /> <cb n="TUNC" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:13" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 13</bibl> (4, 2), 71; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:4:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 11, 4, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:10:2" default="NO">11, 10, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:7:7" default="NO">12, 7, 7</bibl>; 13, 3, 4; 18, 4, 10 et saep.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:2:2:section=26" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 2, 2, § 26</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49420.19" n="(b)" level="5"> Before an <hi rend="ital">abl. absol.</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">statuunt tempus quo foedissimum quemque invadant. Tunc, signo inter se dato, inrumpunt contubernia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tunc, Campaniae ora proximisque insulis circuitis, Caprearum secessui quadriduum impendit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:98" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tunc, exercitu in Aetoliam promoto, pecunias civitatibus imperat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:14:1:6" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 14, 1, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:5:2" default="NO">21, 5, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:22:2:7" default="NO">22, 2, 7</bibl>; 25, 2, 6.—</sense><sense id="n49420.20" n="(g)" level="5"> Implying a consequence, <hi rend="ital">then</hi>, <hi rend="ital">under these circumstances</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accordingly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">caedere januam saxis, instare ferro, ligna circumdare ignemque circumicere coeperunt. Tunc cives Romani, qui Lampsaci negotiabantur, concurrunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:27:section=69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 27, § 69</bibl></cit>: huc tota Vari conversa acies suos fugere videbat. Tunc Rebilus; Perterritum, inquit, hostem vides; <cit><quote lang="la">quid dubitas, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animadversum est, extra consuetudinem longius a vallo esse aciem Pompei progressum. Tunc Caesar apud suos Differendum est iter, inquit, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium spe celerius Saguntum oppugnari adlatum est. Tunc relata de integro res ad senatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 6, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:30:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 30, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tisiphoneque Saevit et huc illuc impia turba fugit. Tunc niger in portā serpentum Cerberus ore Stridet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:3:71" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 3, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud patres disseruit, nec posse Orientem nisi Germanici sapientiā conponi, etc. Tunc decreto patrum permissae Germanico provinciae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 43</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 83</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:8:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 8, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:9:16" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 9, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:39:3:11" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 39, 3, 11</bibl>.—Emphatically, = tum vero: <cit><quote lang="la">donec ipse quoque longinquo morbo est implicitus. Tunc adeo fracti simul cum corpore sunt spiritus illi feroces ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:31:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 31, 6</bibl></cit>.—And = tum primum: <cit><quote lang="la">multitudo tandem perrumpit ordines hostium. Tunc vinci pertinacia coepta, et averti manipuli quidam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:39:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 39, 10</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n49420.21" n="2" level="3"> In enumerations with tum ... deinde ... postea, etc. </sense><sense id="n49420.22" n="(a)" level="5"> In gen. (postclass.): ante omnia instituit ut e libertorum bonis dextans ... cogeretur; deinde ut ingratorum, etc.; <cit><quote lang="la">tunc ut lege majestatis facta omnia ... tenerentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:32" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 32 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">tunc ... deinde ... tunc, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:6:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 6, 12</bibl></cit> and 13: <cit><quote lang="la">tunc ... tunc ... deinde ... tunc,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 5, 5</bibl></cit> and 6; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:12:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 12, 4</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Oth. 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:2:88" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 2, 88</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">tum</hi>: terras primum situmque earum quaerit; deinde condicionem maris; <cit><quote lang="la">tunc quidquid inter caelum terrasque interjacet perspicit ... tum, peragratis humilioribus, ad summa prorumpit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. Helv. 17" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. Helv. 17 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; so Gai <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 3, 6, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49420.23" n="(b)" level="5"> Of successive speakers in dialogue (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">tu vero abi, inquit, etc. Tunc Mucius Quandoquidem, inquit, est apud te virtuti honos, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:12:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 12, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud quem Valerius in hunc modum egit, etc. Tunc Collatinus Quaero inquit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:8:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 8, 2</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">tum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tunc poëta ... inquit, etc. Tum Fronto ita respondit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:8:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 8, 10</bibl></cit> and 11; 12, 13, 19; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:7:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 7, 3</bibl>, ext. 4.—</sense><sense id="n49420.24" n="C" level="2"> In co-ordination (very rare). </sense><sense id="n49420.25" n="1" level="3"> = praeterea, <hi rend="ital">and then</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Romulus) hoc consilio fultus ... locupletari civis non destitit. Tunc, id quod retinemus hodie magnā cum salute rei publicae, auspiciis plurimum obsecutus est Romulus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:9:15 sq" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 9, 15 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeter has, frugalitas et continentia ... splendorem illi suum adfunderent. Tunc providentiā cum elegantiā quantum decoris illi adderent!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 115:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 115, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49420.26" n="2" level="3"> In the connection cum ... tunc (v. tum, I. C. 3.): <cit><quote lang="la">vivendum recte est cum propter plurima, tunc est Idcirco, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:118" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 118</bibl></cit> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> for tum, on account of the foll. vowel).—</sense><sense id="n49420.27" n="3" level="3"> Vid. tunc etiam, III. B. 7. <foreign lang="greek">b</foreign>.</sense><sense id="n49420.28" n="II" level="1"> As correlative of dependent clauses. </sense><sense id="n49420.29" n="A" level="2"> Of temporal clauses with <hi rend="ital">cum.</hi> </sense><sense id="n49420.30" n="1" level="3"> Referring to definite past time. </sense><sense id="n49420.31" n="a" level="4"> Tunc as antecedent of the clause: <cit><quote lang="la">set Stalagmus quojus erat tunc nationis quom hinc abit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">etiamne in arā tunc sedebant mulieres Quom ad me profectu's ire?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 3, 6, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo damnato tunc, cum judicia fiebant, HS. IV milibus lis aestimata est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:10:section=22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 10, § 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">etenim tunc esset hoc animadvertendum cum classis Syracusis proficiscebatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5, 43</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">111: atque ille eo tempore paruit cum parere senatui necesse erat: vos tunc paruistis cum paruit nemo nisi qui voluit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Lig. 7, 20</bibl></cit>: se ita pugnaturos ut Romae pugnaverint in repetendā patriā, ut postero die ad Gabios, tunc cum effecerint ne <cb n="TUNC" /> quis hostium, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:28:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 28, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">et quod tunc fecimus cum hostem Hannibalem in Italiā haberemus, id nunc, pulso Hannibale, cunctamur facere?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 7, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infelix Dido, nunc te facta impia tangunt? Tunc decuit cum sceptra dabas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:597" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 597</bibl></cit> (Rib. tum; v. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 8, 841</bibl> P.): <cit><quote lang="la">prudenter sensit tunc incrementum Romano imperio petendum fuisse cum intra septimum lapidem triumphi quaerebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:1:10" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quorum nihil tunc cum diceretur parum aptum fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:89" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 89</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:8:8" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 8, 8</bibl>, ext. 1; 9, 8, ext. 1.—</sense><sense id="n49420.32" n="b" level="4"> Introducing the apodosis. </sense><sense id="n49420.33" n="(a)" level="5"> Of coincident actions: <cit><quote lang="la">cum jam adpropinquantium forma lemborum haud dubie esset ... tunc injecta trepidatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:28:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 28, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49420.34" n="(b)" level="5"> = deinde: <cit><quote lang="la">adversus singula quaeque cum respondere haud facile esset, et quereretur ... purgaretque se invicem, tunc Papirius, redintegratā irā, virgas et secures expediri jussit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:32:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 32, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">divus Caesar cum exercitum habuisset circa Alpes, imperavissetque, etc., tunc qui in eo castello fuerunt ... noluerunt imperio parere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:9:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 9, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum nuntiatum esset Leonidae a XX milibus hostium summum cacumen teneri, tunc hortatur socios, recedant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:11:5" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 11, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49420.35" n="2" level="3"> Of definite present time, tunc is not found; v. tum.—</sense><sense id="n49420.36" n="3" level="3"> Referring to indefinite time. </sense><sense id="n49420.37" n="a" level="4"> As antecedent: <cit><quote lang="la">arbitror, quo nos etiam tunc utimur cum ea dicimus jurati quae comperta habemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:13:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Font. 13, 29</bibl></cit> (9, 19): <cit><quote lang="la">tunc obsequatur naturae cum senserit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,062:Hort. Phil. 75" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fragm. Hort. Phil. 75</bibl></cit> B. and K.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:6:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 6, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:18:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 1, 18, 55</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 5, 12, § 29</bibl>: qui tunc vocat me, cum malum librum legi, <hi rend="ital">only ... when</hi>, <hi rend="ital">never ... unless</hi> (= <foreign lang="greek">to/te dh/</foreign>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:44:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 44, 21</bibl> Ellis (Müll. tum): <cit><quote lang="la">deum tunc adfuisse cum id evenisset, veteres oratores aiebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 7, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tunc est commovendum theatrum cum ventum est ad illud Plodite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:52" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 1, 52</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 2, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:11:7" default="NO">12, 11, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 9, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluptas tunc, cum maxime delectat, exstinguitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 7:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 7, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 1, prol. 3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Q. N. 1, prol. 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:5:3:3" default="NO">5, 3, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:6:3:1" default="NO">6, 3, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 10:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 10, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:85:38" default="NO">85, 38</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in tantam quantitatem tenetur quae tunc in peculio fuit cum sententiam dicebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:1:15" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 5, 1, 15</bibl></cit>: tunc cum certum esse coeperit neminem ex eo testamento fore heredem, Gai <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 3, 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 71</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:28:3:6:section=6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 28, 3, 6, § 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:40:12:16:section=2" default="NO">40, 12, 16, § 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:40:7:34" default="NO">40, 7, 34</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49420.38" n="b" level="4"> Introducing the apodosis: <cit><quote lang="la">cum autem fundamenta ita distantia inter se fuerint constituta, tunc inter ea alia transversa ... collocentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 5, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 1, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 3, 2</bibl>; 2, 5, 2; <cit><quote lang="la">3, 5, 13: cum folia pauca in acumine germinent, tunc maxime serendas ficus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:245" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 26, 65, § 245</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:2:9" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 41, 2, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49420.39" n="4" level="3"> Referring to future time: <cit><quote lang="la">ex ceteris autem generibus tunc pecunia expedietur cum legionibus victricibus erunt quae spopondimus persolvenda, Cic. Fragm. Ep. Caes. jun. 1, 8: tunc inter eas fore finem belli dixit cum alterutra urbs in habitum pulveris esset redacta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:9:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 9, 3</bibl></cit>, ext. 3: <cit><quote lang="la">poterant videri tunc incohanda cum omnia quae ... peregissem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:4:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 4, 1</bibl></cit>; Col. praef. 33; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>, III. A. 2. <foreign lang="greek">b</foreign>.— </sense><sense id="n49420.40" n="B" level="2"> With temporal clauses introduced by <hi rend="ital">ubi</hi> (rare). </sense><sense id="n49420.41" n="1" level="3"> Of definite past time: <cit><quote lang="la">ad quod bellum ubi consules dilectum habere occipiunt, obstare tunc enixe tribuni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:55:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 55, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec ubi convenerunt, tunc vero Philomelus consuetudinem nocte egrediendi frequentiorem facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:8:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 8, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49420.42" n="2" level="3"> Of indefinite time. </sense><sense id="n49420.43" n="a" level="4"> As antecedent: <cit><quote lang="la">tunc autem est consummata infelicitas, ubi turpia non solum delectant, sed etiam placent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 39:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 39, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 2:3:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ben. 2, 3, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:2:17:3" default="NO">2, 17, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 89:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 89, 19</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49420.44" n="b" level="4"> In apodosis: <cit><quote lang="la">stillicidia ubi plura coiere et turba vires dedit, tunc fluere et ire dicuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 5:13:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 5, 13, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:6:17:2" default="NO">6, 17, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:6:18:2" default="NO">6, 18, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49420.45" n="C" level="2"> With temporal clauses introduced by <hi rend="ital">postquam</hi> (posteaquam); rare. </sense><sense id="n49420.46" n="1" level="3"> Of definite past time: <cit><quote lang="la">posteaquam ingenuae virgines et ephebi venerunt ad deprecandum, tunc est pollicitus his legibus ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:16:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 16, 7</bibl></cit> (but in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 51:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 51, 40</bibl> Dietsch reads tum).—</sense><sense id="n49420.47" n="2" level="3"> Of indefinite time: si vero posteaquam eam destinasses, tunc perierit, etc., Dig 17, 2, 58, § 1.—</sense><sense id="n49420.48" n="D" level="2"> With temporal clauses introduced by <hi rend="ital">ut</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">ut vero ... casus suorum miseris eluxit, tunc toto littore plangentium gemitus, tunc infelicium matrum ululatus ... audiebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19:2:11" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 19, 2, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49420.49" n="E" level="2"> With temporal clauses introduced by <hi rend="ital">quando</hi> (rare). </sense><sense id="n49420.50" n="1" level="3"> As antecedent: <cit><quote lang="la">tunc quando abiero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 7, 19</bibl></cit> (4, 8, 8): tunc inserentur<cb n="TUNC" />  (cerasi) quando his vel non est, vel desinit gummi effluere, <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Oct. 12</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n49420.51" n="2" level="3"> In apodosis: <cit><quote lang="la">quando quodque eorum siderum cursum decorum est adeptum ... tunc ex alterius naturae motione transversa ... vinci a tardioribus videbantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49420.52" n="F" level="1"> With temporal clauses introduced by <hi rend="ital">dum</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">tunc tamen utrumque tolerabile est, dum illi vis sua est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 83:21" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 83, 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49420.53" n="G" level="1"> With conditional clauses. </sense><sense id="n49420.54" n="1" level="3"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n49420.55" n="(a)" level="5"> As antecedent: <cit><quote lang="la">consilium istud tunc esset prudens si rationes ad Hispaniensem casum accommodaturi essemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sin autem ventus interpellaverit et ... tunc habeat canalem longum pedes quinque, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tunc fidem fallam, tunc inconstantiae crimen audiam si, cum omnia eadem sint quae erant promittente me, non praestitero promissum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 4:35:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 4, 35, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49420.56" n="(b)" level="5"> In apodosis: <cit><quote lang="la">si se simul cum gloria rei gestae exstinxisset, tunc victorem, quidquid licuerit in magistro equitum, in militibus ausurum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:31:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 31, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem si inclusit mare, tum ille exitu simul redituque praecluso, volutatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 6:15" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 6, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod si non illum, sed me peccasse putabis, tunc ego te credam cordis habere nihil,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:8:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 8, 6</bibl></cit>: si nullus sit suorum heredum, tunc hereditas pertinet ad adgnatos, Gai <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 3, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si vero dissentiunt, tunc praetoris partes necessariae sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:14:7:section=19" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 2, 14, 7, § 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 6:9:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 6, 9, 2</bibl>; Gai <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 3, 205</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:3:22" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 3, 22</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49420.57" n="2" level="3"> With a supposition contrary to fact: <cit><quote lang="la">audivi te cum alios consolareris: tunc conspexissem, si te ipse consolatus esses,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Prov. 4:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Prov. 4, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49420.58" n="H" level="1"> After <hi rend="ital">abl. absol.</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">legatis auditis, tunc de bello referre sese Aemilius dixit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:21:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 21, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">his ita praeparatis, tunc in rotae modiolo tympanum includatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 9</bibl></cit> (14), 2.</sense><sense id="n49420.59" n="III" level="1"> Particular connections. </sense><sense id="n49420.60" n="A" level="2"> With other particles of time. </sense><sense id="n49420.61" n="1" level="3"> Jam tunc (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">nisi jam tunc omnia negotia diligentissime confecissem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 12, 3</bibl></cit>: bellum jam tunc ab illis geri coeptum cum sibi Phrygiam ademerint, Trog. Pomp. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:53" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 38, 53</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">At. C. Marius L. Sullam jam tunc, ut praecaventibus fatis, copulatum sibi quaestorem habuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:12:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 12, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Archilochum Nepos Cornelius tradit, Tullo Hostilio Romae regnante, jam tunc fuisse poëmatis clarum et nobilem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:21:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 21, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">palam jam tunc multae civitates libertatem bello vindicandam fremebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:5:5" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 13, 5, 5</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n49420.62" n="2" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">demum</hi> and <hi rend="ital">denique</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not until then</hi>, <hi rend="ital">then only</hi>, <hi rend="ital">then at last.</hi> </sense><sense id="n49420.63" n="a" level="4"> Tunc demum. </sense><sense id="n49420.64" n="(a)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">tunc demum nuntius missus ad tertiam legionem revocandam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tunc demum pectora plangi Contigit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:11:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 11, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tunc demum intrat tabernaculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:13:20" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 13, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tunc demum alia mala (exstiterunt),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 1:17:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 1, 17, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(aquilae) primo deponunt, expertaeque pondus, tunc demum abeunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 3, 4, § 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tunc demum ... invidiam quae sibi fieret deprecati sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:9" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tunc demum ad otium concessit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49420.65" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">cum</hi> clause: <cit><quote lang="la">postero die cum circumsessi aquā arceremur, nec ulla ... erumpendi spes esset, tunc demum pacti sumus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:59:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 59, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et serius cum redisset, tum demum, recepto sospite filio, victoriae tantae gaudium consul sensit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:44:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 44, 44, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ab his oritur, tunc demum ei ratio constat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:8" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 8</bibl></cit> prooem.: quos ordine suo tunc demum persequar cum praefaturus fuero, Col. praef. 33; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 84:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 84, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 7:13:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Q. N. 7, 13, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49420.66" n="b" level="4"> Tunc denique (very rare): hi dicebantur in eo tempore <foreign lang="greek">maqhmatikoi/</foreign>. Exinde ad perspicienda principia naturae procedebant ac tunc denique nominabantur <foreign lang="greek">fusikoi/</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:9:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 9, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49420.67" n="3" level="3"> Tunc primum: <cit><quote lang="la">quia tunc primum superbiae nobilitatis obviam itum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tunc primum circo qui nunc maximus dicitur, designatus locus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:35:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 35, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eum dolorem ulta est (plebs) tunc primum plebeis quaestoribus creatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:54:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 54, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tunc primum equo merere equites coeperunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:7:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 7, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lectisternio tunc primum in urbe Romanā facto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:13:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 13, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:17" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:5:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 8, 5, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:10:2" default="NO">11, 10, 2</bibl>; Jul. <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Anton. Phil. 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49420.68" n="4" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">deinde</hi> (cf.: tum deinde). </sense><sense id="n49420.69" n="(a)" level="5"> Deinde tunc: <cit><quote lang="la">roga bonam mentem, bonam valetudinem animi, deinde tunc corporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 10:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 10, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:74:23" default="NO">74, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:117:1" default="NO">117, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49420.70" n="(b)" level="5"> Tunc deinde: primum militiae vinculum est religio et signorum amor, et deserendi nefas; tunc deinde facile cetera <pb n="1916" /> <cb n="TUND" /> exiguntur, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 95:35" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 95, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:11:4" default="NO">11, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:8:109" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 8, 109</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 15</bibl>.—So, tunc postea, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:6:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 6, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49420.71" n="5" level="3"> Tunc tandem: <cit><quote lang="la">simul enim cessit possessione Dii, excitavit hostem, ut tunc tandem sciret recuperanda esse quae prius amissa forent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 8, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49420.72" n="B" level="2"> With emphatic particles. </sense><sense id="n49420.73" n="1" level="3"> Tunc vero (or enimvero): <cit><quote lang="la">in turbatos jam hostes equos inmittunt. Tunc vero Celtiberi omnes in fugam effunduntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:40:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 40, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cunctantem tamen ingens vis morbi adorta est. Tunc enim vero deorum ira admonuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:36:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 36, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tunc vero impotentis fortunae species conspici potuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:11:23" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 11, 23</bibl></cit>: Tiberioque suspensa semper verba; <cit><quote lang="la">tunc vero nitenti, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49420.74" n="2" level="3"> Tunc quidem: et tunc quidem Perseus copias reduxit; <cit><quote lang="la">postero die, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:57:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 57, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tunc quidem sacrificio rite perpetrato, reliquum noctis rediit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:13:16" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 13, 16</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:12:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 12, 21</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n49420.75" n="3" level="3"> Ne tunc quidem: <cit><quote lang="la">quia ne tunc quidem obsistebatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 3:17:9" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 3, 17, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ac ne tum quidem senatu aut populo appellato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:41" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 41</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:27:3:6" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 27, 3, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49420.76" n="4" level="3"> Tunc maxime (or tunc cum maxime). </sense><sense id="n49420.77" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Chiefly at that time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">especially then</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Theophrastus est auctor, in Ponto quosdam amnes crescere tempore aestivo ... aut quia tunc maxime in umorem mutabilis terra est, aut quia, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3:26:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 3, 26, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49420.78" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Just then</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hospitem tunc cum maxime utilia suadentem abstrahi jussit ad capitale supplicium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:2:17" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 2, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non incidunt causae quae iram lacessant? sed tunc maxime illi oppugnandae manus sunt, Sen. de Ira, 2, 14, 2: sapiens tunc maxime paupertatem meditatur cum in mediis divitiis constitit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:Vit. Beat. 26:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vit. Beat. 26, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49420.79" n="5" level="3"> Tunc interea, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:7:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 7, 7</bibl>; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">supra</ref></xr>, I. A. 4. <foreign lang="greek">a</foreign>.—</sense><sense id="n49420.80" n="6" level="3"> Etiam tunc. </sense><sense id="n49420.81" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Even then</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">experiri etiam tunc volens an ullae sibi reliquae vires essent, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:16:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 16, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49420.82" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Still</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam defunctam praetextatus etiam tunc pro rostris laudavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 10</bibl></cit>.— And with <hi rend="ital">cum</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 6, 8</bibl>; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">supra</ref></xr>, II. A. 1. a.—</sense><sense id="n49420.83" n="7" level="3"> Tunc etiam. </sense><sense id="n49420.84" n="(a)" level="5"> Etiam as connective, tum = eo tempore: <cit><quote lang="la">in civitate plena religionum, tunc etiam ob recentem cladem superstitiosis principibus, ut renovarentur auspicia, res ad interregnum redit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 5, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49420.85" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> for tum etiam, on account of the vowel: <cit><quote lang="la">ultima prona via est, et eget moderamine certo, Tunc etiam ... Tethys solet ipsa vereri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 68</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n49420.86" n="8" level="3"> Tunc quoque. </sense><sense id="n49420.87" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Also then</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">irae adversus Vejentes in insequentem annum dilatae sunt. Tunc quoque ne confestim bellum indiceretur religio obstitit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:30:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 30, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:37:12" default="NO" valid="yes">44, 37, 12</bibl>: saepe legit flores; <cit><quote lang="la">et tunc quoque forte legebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:315" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 315</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quare et sereno tonat? quia tunc quoque per quassum et scissum aëra spiritus prosilit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 2:18" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 2, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum quidam histriones producti olim, tunc quoque producerentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:21" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tunc quoque in Hyrcaniam remittitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:9:9" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 38, 9, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49420.88" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Even then</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tunc quoque cum antiqui illi viri inclite viverent, cura comere capillum fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 1:17:7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 1, 17, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">faba vero non antequam trium foliorum. Tunc quoque levi sarculo purgare melius quam fodere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:241" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 26, 65, § 241</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:26" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:7:12" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 7, 12</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">tum demum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tametsi ad audiendum pigre coitur. Plerique in stationibus sedent ... ac sibi nuntiari jubent an jam recitator intraverit ... an ex magnā parte evolverit librum: tum demum ac tunc quoque lente cunctanterque veniunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 13, 2</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n49420.89" n="(g)" level="5"> = sic quoque, <hi rend="ital">even as it was</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quin nisi firmata extrema agminis fuissent, ingens in eo saltu accipienda clades fuerit. Tunc quoque ad extremum periculi ventum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:34:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 34, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49420.90" n="C" level="2"> Tunc temporis (postclass.; <cit><quote lang="la">v. tum, III. E.): ex gente obscura tunc temporis Persarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:4:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 1, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parvae tunc temporis vires Atheniensibus erant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:6:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 6, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad abolendam invidiae famam quā insignis praeter ceteros tunc temporis habebatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:3:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">erat namque tunc temporis urbs Appulis Brundisium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:2:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 2, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tundo: <entryFree id="n49421" type="main" key="tundo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tundo</orth>, <itype>tŭtŭdi, tunsum, tūssum, and tusum</itype> (v. Neue, Formenl. II. 568), 3 (old collat. form of the <sense id="n49421.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> tuserunt, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0112,001:1:1" default="NO"><author>Naev.</author> 1, 1</bibl>: tunsi, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 369</bibl> P.; <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> tundier, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:934" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 934</bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>Sanscr. tu-dāmi, thrust; cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">*tudeu/s, *tunda/reos</foreign></etym>, <hi rend="ital">to beat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strike</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thump</hi>, <hi rend="ital">buffet</hi> with repeated strokes. </sense><sense id="n49421.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n49421.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. (class.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">verbero, pulso, ico, impello, cudo): oculos converso bacillo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:54:section=142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 54, § 142</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectus palo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:5:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 5, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectora manu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:9:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 9, 10</bibl></cit>; id. <cb n="TUNI" /> M. 8, 535; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 37</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inania tympana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:183" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 183</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tundere ac diverberare ubera,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7, p. 200, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapidem digito cum tundimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:265" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 265</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus crebro ictu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:934" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 934</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pede terram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:430" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 430</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">humum ossibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:293" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 293</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ulmum (picus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 1, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litus undā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:11:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 11, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">saxa alto salo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:17:55" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 17, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cymbala rauca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl></cit> (4), 16, 36: <cit><quote lang="la">chelyn digitis errantibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:5:33" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 5, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gens effrena virum Rhipaeo tunditur Euro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:382" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 382</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saxum, quod tumidis tunditur olim Fluctibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 5, 125</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">miserum sancto tundere poste caput,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:2:86" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 2, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferrum rubens non est habile tundendo,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>is not easy to beat out</tr>, <tr>not very malleable</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 15, 43, § 149</bibl></cit>.—In a
