Greek construction: <cit><quote lang="la">tunsae pectora palmis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:481" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 481</bibl></cit>. —Prov.: uno opere eandem incudem diem noctemque tundere, <hi rend="ital">to hammer the same anvil</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to keep at the same work</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:39:162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 39, 162</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49421.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to pound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bruise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bray</hi>, as in a mortar (cf. pinso): <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid in pilā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 22, 43, § 126</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:207" default="NO" valid="yes">20, 19, 79, § 207</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in farinam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 7, 40, § 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in pollinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 19, 5, 29, § 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tunsum gallae admiscere saporem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:267" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 267</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tunsa viscera,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 302</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">grana mali Punici tunsa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:13:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 13, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tunsum allium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:8:2 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 8, 2 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">testam tusam et succretam arenae adicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">testa tunsa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:186" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 25, 62, § 186</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hordeum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 152, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec omnia tusa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 1, 16, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49421.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (qs. to keep pounding or hammering at a person), <hi rend="ital">to din</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stun</hi>, <hi rend="ital">keep on at</hi>, <hi rend="ital">importune</hi> a person by repeating the same thing (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and rare): <cit><quote lang="la">pergin' aures tundere?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 3, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">assiduis hinc atque hinc vocibus heros Tunditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:448" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 448</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tundat Amycle, Natalem Mais Idibus esse tuum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 5, 35.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">tundendo atque odio denique effecit senex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:1:2:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 1, 2, 48</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tunes: <entryFree id="n49422" type="main" key="Tu_ne_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tūnēs</orth>, <itype>ētis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n49422.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a maritime town of Africa Propria</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Tunis</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Scipio occupat relictum Tuneta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:9:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 9, 16</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Acc.</hi> Tunetem, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:36:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 36, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tungri: <entryFree id="n49423" type="main" key="Tungri"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tungri</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n49423.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of</hi> Gallia Belgica, near the modern <hi rend="ital">Tongres</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 17, 31, § 106</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:12" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 2, 8, § 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:14 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 14 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 16, 55</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 11, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3399</bibl>.—In <number>sing.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tunger</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:682" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 682</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 334, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tunica: <entryFree id="n49424" type="main" key="tu^ni^ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tŭnĭca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>perh. for tog-nica, from tego</etym>, <sense id="n49424.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an under-garment of the Romans worn by both sexes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a tunic.</hi> </sense><sense id="n49424.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 46</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 2, 60</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 93</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:3:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 1, 3, 75</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:20:60" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 20, 60</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:47:195" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 47, 195</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 132</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 96</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 18, 33</bibl>.—A tunic with long sleeves was thought effeminate, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:4:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 2, 4, 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:10:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 10, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:52" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:12:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 12, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">et tunicae manicas habent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:616" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 616</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manicata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:3:13" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 3, 13</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:194" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 48, 74, § 194</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tunicas mutare cottidie,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 22, 32</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: tunica propior pallio est, <hi rend="ital">my tunic is nearer than my cloak</hi> (like the Engl. <hi rend="ital">near is my shirt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">but nearer is my skin</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:5:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 5, 2, 30</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49424.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a coating</hi>, <hi rend="ital">skin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tegument</hi>, <hi rend="ital">membrane</hi>, <hi rend="ital">husk</hi>, <hi rend="ital">peel</hi>, etc., = velamentum, membrana: <cit><quote lang="la">se medio trudunt de cortice gemmae Et tenues rumpunt tunicas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum teretes ponunt tunicas aestate cicadae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 58</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">oculorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:7:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 7, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 54, § 147</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">boletorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 22, 46, § 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corticis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 3, 3, § 7</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">inter corticem ac lignum tenues tunicae multiplici membranā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 16, 14, 25, § 65</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:163" default="NO" valid="yes">16, 36, 65, § 163</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tunicatus: <entryFree id="n49425" type="main" key="tu^ni^ca_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tŭnĭcātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. tunico.</entryFree>
tunico: <entryFree id="n49426" type="main" key="tu^ni^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tŭnĭco</orth>, no <sense id="n49426.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>tunica</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to clothe with a tunic.</hi> </sense><sense id="n49426.1" n="I" level="1"> In the <hi rend="ital">verb. finit.</hi> only once: tunicare homulum, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 182, 17</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49426.2" n="II" level="1"> In <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi> (freq. and class.): <orth extent="full" lang="la">tŭnĭcātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">clothed with a tunic</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 5, 11</bibl>; cf. in <usg type="style">poet.</usg> transf., of life in the country: <cit><quote lang="la">o tunicata quies!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:51:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 51, 6</bibl></cit>.—Of the common people, who went clothed simply with the tunic: <cit><quote lang="la">novistin' tu illunc tunicatum hominem?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui metus erat tunicatorum illorum?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:34:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 34, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">popellus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 65</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 7</bibl>.—So of the Carthaginians: juventus, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:12" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 12</bibl> (Ann. v. 331 Vahl.).—</sense><sense id="n49426.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">covered with a coat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">skin</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">peel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">coated</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tunicatum caepe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:4:3" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 4, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tunicopallium: <entryFree id="n49427" type="gloss" key="tu^ni^copalli^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tŭnĭcopallĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>tunica-pallium</etym>,<cb n="TURB" />  <sense id="n49427.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a garment uniting in one the tunic and the pallium</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 1, 648</bibl>; ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 99</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 537, 33</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tunicula: <entryFree id="n49428" type="main" key="tu^ni^cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tŭnĭcŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>tunica</etym>. <sense id="n49428.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A little tunic</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:6:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 6, 65</bibl>; Turp. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 538, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 228:27" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> ib. 228, 27</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49428.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A little coat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">skin</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">membrane</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 12, 76, § 123</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:124" default="NO" valid="yes">29, 6, 38, § 124</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">stellionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 10, 27, § 88</bibl></cit>: hordei, Fest. s. v. gluma, p. 98 Müll.</sense></entryFree>
tunsus: <entryFree id="n49429" type="main" key="tunsus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tunsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of tundo.</entryFree>
tuor: <entryFree id="n49430" type="main" key="tu^or1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tŭor</orth>, <itype>tŭi</itype>, v. tueor <sense id="n49430.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n49431" type="hapax" key="tu^or2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tŭor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. tuor, = tueor</etym>, <sense id="n49431.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the sight</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vision</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">radios omnis nostri tuoris raritate transmittunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> de Deo Socr. p. 48</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
turalis: <entryFree id="n49432" type="hapax" key="tu_ra_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tūrālis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">thūr-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>tus</etym>, <sense id="n49432.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to incense</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incense-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">arca,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 5, 745</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
turarius: <entryFree id="n49433" type="main" key="tu_ra_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tūrārĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">thūr-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n49433.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to frankincense.</hi> </sense><sense id="n49433.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n49433.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: tibiae, <hi rend="ital">incense-flutes</hi>, i. e. flutes played upon while the incense was burned at sacrifices, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 5 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl> (called also tibiae sacrificae Tuscorum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 36, 66, § 172</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:193" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 193</bibl>).—</sense><sense id="n49433.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">tūrārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a dealer in frankincense</hi>, Firm. Math. 8, 25 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Idol. 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4291</bibl>; cf. Marini, Fratr. Arv. p. 338.—</sense><sense id="n49433.4" n="II" level="1"> Vicus Turarius, <hi rend="ital">a street in Rome</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the eighth region</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0803,001:Cic. Verr. 2:1:59:section=154" default="NO"><author>Ascon.</author> Cic. Verr. 2, 1, 59, § 154</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
turba: <entryFree id="n49434" type="greek" key="turba"><orth extent="full" lang="la">turba</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>= <foreign lang="greek">tu/rbh</foreign>; cf. Sanscr. turāmi, to hasten; turas, hasty; Lat. turma</etym>, <sense id="n49434.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a turmoil</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hubbub</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uproar</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disorder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tumult</hi>, <hi rend="ital">commotion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disturbance</hi>, of a crowd of people (syn. tumultus): praetor ait: cujus dolo malo in turbā damnum quod factum esse dicetur ... Turbam appellatam Labeo ait ex genere tumultūs, idque verbum ex Graeco tractum <foreign lang="greek">a)po\ tou= qorubei=n</foreign>. Turbam autem ex quo numero admittimus? Si duo rixam commiserint, utique non accipiemus in turbā id factum, quia duo turba non proprie dicentur. Enimvero si plures fuerint, decem aut quindecim homines, turba dicentur. Quid ergo, si tres aut quattuor? Turba utique non erit. Et rectissime Labeo inter turbam et rixam multum interesse ait; <cit><quote lang="la">namque turbam multitudinis hominum esse turbationem et coetum, rixam etiam duorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:8:4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 8, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turba et confusio rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 6, 13</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut exsistat ex populo turba et confusio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:45:69" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 45, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vis belli ac turba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:32:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 32, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multitudo ac turba fugientium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turbā atque seditionibus sine curā aluntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 37:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 37, 3</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">seditiones turbaeque populares,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:16:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 16, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">efficere turbas in castris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:12:section=31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 12, § 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turba est nunc apud aram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter Officium turbamque sacri vocesque precantūm,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">festaque confusā resonabat regia turbā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:12:214" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 214</bibl></cit> et saep.— </sense><sense id="n49434.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n49434.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen., for a disturbance made by a few or a single person, <hi rend="ital">a brawl</hi>, <hi rend="ital">confusion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disturbance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quarrel</hi> (in good prose rare): non vides, quam turbam quosve fluctus concites? Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 524, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">turba atque rixa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:66:section=149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 66, § 149</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fugiam intro, ne quid hic turbae fiat itidem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:9:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 9, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Amphitruo actutum uxori turbas conciet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 2</bibl></cit>. 14: <cit><quote lang="la">quas mihi filius turbas turbet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 10, 1</bibl></cit>: ebrius turbam aliquam dare, Caecil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 525, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam tum inceperat Turba inter eos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:4:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 4, 59</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 3, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 1, 2, 16</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 2, 17</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n49434.3" n="B" level="2"> Concr., <hi rend="ital">a crowd</hi>, <hi rend="ital">throng</hi>, <hi rend="ital">multitude</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mob; a band</hi>, <hi rend="ital">train</hi>, <hi rend="ital">troop</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n49434.4" n="1" level="3"> Of persons (freq. and class.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">multitudo, vulgus): in foro turbāque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:17:28" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 17, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domus praetoria turbā referta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:52:section=137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 52, § 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut te eripias ex eā, quam ego congessi in hunc sermonem, turbā patronorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:97:332" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 97, 332</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">admiratio vulgi atque turbae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ex hac turbā et colluvione discedam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:23:85" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 23, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">videt in turbā Verrem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 1, 7, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turbae carmina,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 2, 136</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Iliadum turbā comitata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:580" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 580</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnis Circi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:45" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominum ejus aetatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">discipulorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:5:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 5, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnis eum stipata tegebat Turba ducum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scriptorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl></cit> (4), 1, 12: <cit><quote lang="la">Dario majorem turbam hominum esse, virorum sibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:14:10" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 11, 14, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">forensem turbam in quattuor tribus conjecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:46:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 46, 14</bibl></cit>: consul alter velut unus, militaris<pb n="1917" /> <cb n="TURB" />  turba erat, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:42:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 42, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">conferta turba iter reliquum clauserat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:49:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 39, 49, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Quiritium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clientium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poëtarum seniorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:10:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 10, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pauperiorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1, 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mea turba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:15:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 15, 10</bibl></cit>.—Esp., <hi rend="ital">the common crowd</hi>, = vulgus: <cit><quote lang="la">turba patronorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:97:332" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 97, 332</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49434.5" n="2" level="3"> Without the notion of a crowd or confusion, <hi rend="ital">a great number</hi>, <hi rend="ital">multitude</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid tibi de turbā narrem numeroque virorum?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 15</bibl></cit> (16), 181: <cit><quote lang="la">plebes, turbā conspectior cum dignitates deessent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:40:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 40, 4</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n49434.6" n="3" level="3"> Of other things, animate or inanimate, <hi rend="ital">a crowd</hi>, <hi rend="ital">throng</hi>, <hi rend="ital">troop</hi>, <hi rend="ital">multitude</hi>, <hi rend="ital">number</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">turba ignotorum deorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:15:39" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 15, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeter vulgum turbamque animantum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:920" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 920</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">canum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:722" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 722</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">volucrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:10:144" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 144</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">luporum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:129" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 129</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">materiaï,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:1113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 1113</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:127" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 127</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">refertis itineribus agrestium turbā pecorumque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:10:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 10, 8</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 106</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rotarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:6:219" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 219</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jaculorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:7:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 4, 7, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulnerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 61, § 162</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">castrensium negotiorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:25:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 25, 1</bibl></cit>.—Of a speech: <cit><quote lang="la">mediocria in mediam turbam atque in gregem coiciantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:77:314" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 77, 314</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inanium verborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:2:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 2, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">argumentorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:82" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 2, 82</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:5:7" default="NO">4, 5, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:12" default="NO">5, 13, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
turbamentum: <entryFree id="n49435" type="main" key="turba_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">turbāmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>turbo</etym>, <sense id="n49435.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a means of disturbance</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">turbamenta reipublicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:Or. Lepid. 11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> Or. Lepid. 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turbamenta vulgi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 23</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
turbassit: <entryFree id="n49436" type="main" key="turbassit"><orth extent="full" lang="la">turbassit</orth> = turbaverit, v. turbo.</entryFree>
turbate: <entryFree id="n49437" type="main" key="turba_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">turbātē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. 1. turbo, <sense id="n49437.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
turbatio: <entryFree id="n49438" type="main" key="turba_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">turbātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. turbo</etym>, <sense id="n49438.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">confusion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disorder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disturbance</hi> (perh. not ante-Aug.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">conturbatio, perturbatio): turbam multitudinis hominum esse turbationem et coetum, rixam etiam duorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:8:4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 8, 4</bibl></cit> (v. turba <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:28:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 28, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reipublicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:6:2" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coloris et vultūs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:1:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non sine magnā turbatione,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 271, 30</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
turbator: <entryFree id="n49439" type="main" key="turba_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">turbātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n49439.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a troubler</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disquieter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disturber</hi> (not ante-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">turbatores vulgi erant tribuni plebis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:48:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 48, 1</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">vulgi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plebis (Gracchi et Saturnini),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Germaniae (Arminius),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 55</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">otii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 3:17" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 3, 17</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.—Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">turbatores belli,</quote> <trans><tr>stirrers up of war</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:16:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 16, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
turbatrix: <entryFree id="n49440" type="main" key="turba_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">turbātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>turbator</etym>, <sense id="n49440.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that troubles</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disquiets</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">disturbs</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">turbatrix fama,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:369" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 369</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pacis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Psych. 668</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
turbatus: <entryFree id="n49441" type="main" key="turba_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">turbātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos> of 1. turbo.</entryFree>
turbellae: <entryFree id="n49442" type="main" key="turbellae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">turbellae</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">turbēlae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>turba</etym>. <sense id="n49442.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A bustle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stir</hi>, <hi rend="ital">row</hi> (only in vulg. lang.): <cit><quote lang="la">tantas turbellas facio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:9:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 9, 134</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:1:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 1, 108</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> de Deo Socr. p. 48, 20</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n49442.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A little crowd</hi>, <hi rend="ital">multitude</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">populi circumfluentis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 151, 39 al.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
turben: <entryFree id="n49443" type="main" key="turben"><orth extent="full" lang="la">turben</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, v. 2. turbo <sense id="n49443.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
turbide: <entryFree id="n49444" type="main" key="turbi^de_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">turbĭdē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. turbidus <sense id="n49444.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
turbido: <entryFree id="n49445" type="main" key="turbi^do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">turbĭdo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>turbidus</etym>, <sense id="n49445.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to trouble</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to make turbid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to disturb</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obscure</hi> (post-class.). </sense><sense id="n49445.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 49 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aër turbidatus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 2, § 165</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n49445.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">laetitiam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 1, § 67</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">serenitatem animae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 6, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
turbidulus: <entryFree id="n49446" type="hapax" key="turbi^du^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">turbĭdŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n49446.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">somewhat disturbed</hi> or <hi rend="ital">confused</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sensus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Apoth. 276</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
turbidus: <entryFree id="n49447" type="main" key="turbi^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">turbĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>turba</etym>, <sense id="n49447.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of confusion</hi> or <hi rend="ital">disorder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wild</hi>, <hi rend="ital">confused</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disordered</hi> (class.; cf.: agitatus, tumultuosus). </sense><sense id="n49447.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">turbida tempestas heri fuit,</quote> <trans><tr>wild</tr>, <tr>stormy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempestas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 169</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:376" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 376</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv 1, 3, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:15" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempestas telorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:283" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 283</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Auster,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aequora ponti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1000" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1000</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scaturiges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:33:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 33, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nubila,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:245" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 245</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelum inmite ac turbidum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:17:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 17, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imber,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:685" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 685</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caligine atrā Pulvis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 876</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:10:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 10, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">freta ventis Turbida,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 17</bibl></cit> (18), 7.—</sense><sense id="n49447.2" n="B" level="2"> In partic., of fluids, <hi rend="ital">troubled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thick</hi>, <hi rend="ital">muddy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">turbid</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aqua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:34:97" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 34, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">torrentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turbidus caeno gurges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:296" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 296</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auro turbidus Hermus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 2, 137</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49447.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">troubled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disordered</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disturbed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perplexed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">violent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">boisterous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">turbulent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vehement</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mens, quae omni turbido motu semper vacet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:33:80" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 33, 80</bibl></cit>: turbidi animorum, concitatique motus, id. <cb n="TURB" /> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 4, 15, 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Venulo adversum se turbidus infert,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:742" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 742</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">9, 57</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">turbidus et clamosus altercator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:4:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reduxit in hiberna turbidos et nihil ausos,</quote> <trans><tr>mutinous</tr>, <tr>seditious</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 38</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">civitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex oculis se turbidus abstulit Arruns,</quote> <trans><tr>frightened</tr>, <tr>confused</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:814" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 814</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">frons,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 432" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 432</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acies oculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 954" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Herc. Fur. 954</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lumen lunae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 790" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Hippol. 790</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:246" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 246</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">C. Caesar turbidus animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turbidus irae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:417" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 12, 417</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which: turbidus irā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:1:39" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 1, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turbidus ausi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:214" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 214</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res timida aut turbida,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>troubled</tr>, <tr>dangerous</tr>, <tr>perilous</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:5:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 5, 1, 11</bibl></cit>; cf.: res turbidas tractare, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:45:199" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 45, 199</bibl> (Trag. v. 189 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">esse in turbidis rebus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:16:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 16, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc tum turbido tempore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Pelop. 4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Pelop. 4, 1</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectora sunt ipso turbidiora mari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:11:34" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 11, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tumultuosius atque turbidius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:60" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 8, 60</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">turbidissimus quisque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">actiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:28" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 28</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n49447.4" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr. absol.</hi>: si turbidissima sapienter ferebas, <hi rend="ital">the most perilous</hi> or <hi rend="ital">troubled circumstances</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:14:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 14, 3</bibl>: nisi quod in turbido minus perspicuum fore putent quid agatur, <hi rend="ital">in confused</hi> or <hi rend="ital">troubled times</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:40:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 40, 10</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">in turbido,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 3:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 3, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:3:18" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 3, 18</bibl>.—Turbidum, adverb.: <cit><quote lang="la">mens turbidum Laetatur,</quote> <trans><tr>confusedly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:19:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 19, 6</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">turbĭdē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in disorder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">confusedly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:10:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 10, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:9:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 9, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
turbinatio: <entryFree id="n49448" type="hapax" key="turbi^na_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">turbĭnātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>turbinatus</etym>, <sense id="n49448.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pointing in the form of a cone</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">piri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 21, 23, § 85</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
turbinatus: <entryFree id="n49449" type="main" key="turbi^na_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">turbĭnātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. turbo</etym>, <sense id="n49449.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">coneshaped</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pointed like a cone</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conical.</hi> </sense><sense id="n49449.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">adamas ... turbinatus in mucronem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 4, 15, § 56</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:181" default="NO" valid="yes">11, 37, 69, § 181</bibl>. —<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">turbinatior piris figura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 15, 17, § 58</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49449.2" n="II" level="1"> As <hi rend="ital">adj. propr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapis Turbinatus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3304</bibl></cit> and 6616.</sense></entryFree>
turbineus: <entryFree id="n49450" type="hapax" key="turbi^ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">turbĭnĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n49450.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">shaped like a top</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cone-shaped</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vortex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:556" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 556</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
turbo: <entryFree id="n49451" type="main" key="turbo1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">turbo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> (<sense id="n49451.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fut. perf.</hi> turbassit, for turbaverit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 4</bibl>; al. turbassitur) [turba], <hi rend="ital">to disturb</hi>, <hi rend="ital">agitate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">confuse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disorder; to throw into disorder</hi> or <hi rend="ital">confusion</hi> (freq. and class.; syn.: confundo, misceo, agito). </sense><sense id="n49451.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventorum vi agitari atque turbari mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:49:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 49, 138</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aequora ventis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hibernum mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:15:8" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 15, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 154</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 545 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eversae turbant convivia mensae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:12:222" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 222</bibl></cit>; cf. in a <usg type="style">poet.</usg> transf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ancipiti quoniam bello turbatur utrimque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:377" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 377</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne comae turbarentur, quas componi vetuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:148" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 148</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne turbet toga mota capillos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:2:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 2, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capillos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:859" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 8, 859</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:14:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 3, 14, 33</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">in a Greek construction: turbata capillos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:474" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 4, 474</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ceram,</quote> <trans><tr>the seal</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:8:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 8, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uvae recentes alvum turbant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 1, 6, § 10</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">instat, turbatque ruitque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 134</bibl></cit>.—Reflex.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum mare turbaret (sc. se),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:17:7" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 17, 7</bibl></cit> Schneid. ad loc. (al. turbaretur).—</sense><sense id="n49451.2" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n49451.3" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="dom">Milit. t. t.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to throw into disorder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">break</hi> the line of battle, <hi rend="ital">disorganize</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">equitatus turbaverat ordines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:70:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 70, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aciem peditum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:18:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 18, 10</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">equites eruptione factā in agmen modice primo impetu turbavere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:13:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 13, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turbantibus invicem copiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:2:49" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 2, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic rem Romanam, magno turbante tumultu, sistet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:857" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 857</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49451.4" n="2" level="3"> Of water, <hi rend="ital">to trouble</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make thick</hi> or <hi rend="ital">turbid</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:364" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 364</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fons quem nulla volucris turbarat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:410" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 410</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flumen imbre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:13:889" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 889</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">limo aquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquas lacrimis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:475" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 475</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pulvis sputo turbatus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 131</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49451.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">non modo illa permiscuit, sed etiam delectum atque ordinem turbavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:50:section=123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 50, § 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui omnia inflma summis paria fecit, turbavit, miscuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:9:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 3, 9, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aristoteles quoque multa turbat, a magistro Platone non dissentiens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:13:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 13, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantas res turbo!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quas meus filius turbas turbet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 9, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quae meus filius turbavit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 1, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:5:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 5, 2, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne quid ille turbet vide,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:7:section=24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 7, § 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec, quae in re publicā turbantur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 9, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum dies alicui nobilium dicta novis semper certaminibus contiones turbaret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:66:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 66, 2</bibl></cit>: ne incertā <cb n="TURB" /> prole auspicia turbarentur, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 6, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">milites nihil in commune turbantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turbantur (testes),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:7:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 7, 11</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:5:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 5, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:14:29" default="NO">5, 14, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:6" default="NO">10, 7, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">spem pacis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:16:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 16, 5</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Absol.: Ph.</hi> Ea nos perturbat. <hi rend="ital">Pa.</hi> Dum ne reducam, turbent porro, quam velint, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 4, 4, 12</bibl> (cf. I. B. 1. supra): <cit><quote lang="la">repente turbare Fortuna coepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si una alterave civitas turbet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 47</bibl></cit>: M. Servilius postquam, ut coeperat, omnibus in rebus turbarat, i. e. <hi rend="ital">had deranged all his affairs</hi>, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 8, 2</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nescio quid absente nobis turbatum'st domi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">totis Usque adeo turbatur agris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 1, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si in Hispaniā turbatum esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:20:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 20, 57</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">turbātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">troubled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disturbed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disordered</hi>, <hi rend="ital">agitated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excited.</hi> </sense><sense id="n49451.6" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">turbatius mare ingressus,</quote> <trans><tr>more stormy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:23" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turbatius caelum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:69" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 69</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49451.7" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostes inopinato malo turbati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculis simul ac mente turbatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:26:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 26, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turbatus religione simul ac periculo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:19" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 19</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">turbatus animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:678" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 678</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">placare voluntates turbatas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 4, 11</bibl></cit>: seditionibus omnia turbata sunt, Sall. Or. Phil. contr. Lep<bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">turbata cum Romanis pax,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:18:2:10" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 18, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia soluta, turbata atque etiam in contrarium versa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:14:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 14, 7</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quae si confusa, turbata, permixta sunt, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 9:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 5, 3</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">turbātē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">confusedly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disorderly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aguntur omnia raptim atque turbate,</quote> <trans><tr>in confusion</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 5, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n49452" type="main" key="turbo2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">turbo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">tur-ben</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:5:3" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 5, 3</bibl>; id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 118</bibl> P.; <sense id="n49452.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> turbonis, Caes. ib.) [1. turbo], <hi rend="ital">that which spins</hi> or <hi rend="ital">twirls round</hi> (cf. vertex). </sense><sense id="n49452.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A whirlwind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hurricane</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tornado</hi>: ventus circumactus et eundem ambiens locum et se ipse vertigine concitans turbo est. Qui si pugnacior est ac diutius volutatur, inflammatur, et efficit, quem <foreign lang="greek">prhsth=ra</foreign> Graeci vocant: <cit><quote lang="la">hic est igneus turbo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 5:13:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 5, 13, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">falsum est faces et trabes turbine exprimi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 7:5:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 5, 1</bibl></cit>; 2, 22, 2; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 109:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 109, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">procellae, turbines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:20:51" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 20, 51</bibl></cit>; cf.: saevi exsistunt turbines, Pac. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:39:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 39, 157</bibl> (Trag. Rel. p. 111 Rib.); Enn. ap. Schol. Vat. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 4</bibl> (Ann. v. 553 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">venti vis rapido percurrens turbine campos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:273" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 273</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:279" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 279</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:294" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 294</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:217" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 217</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:310" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 310</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatus decrevit, ut Minerva, quam turbo dejecerat, restitueretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:25:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 25, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turbo aut subita tempestas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:32:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 32, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulvis collectus turbine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venti rotanti turbine portant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:294" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 294</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita turbine nigro Ferret hiemps,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:320" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 320</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venti ruunt et terras turbine perflant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">accendi turbine quodam aëris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 7:4:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 7, 4, 1</bibl></cit>.—In apposition with ventus: <cit><quote lang="la">exoritur ventus turbo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:5:2:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 5, 2, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circumstabant navem turbines venti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 4, 1, 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49452.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">whirlwind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">storm</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">qui in maximis turbinibus ac fluctibus rei publicae navem gubernassem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:9:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 9, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu, procella patriae, turbo ac tempestas pacis atque otii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:53:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 53, 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego te in medio versantem turbine leti Eripui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 149</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum illi soli essent duo rei publicae turbines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:11:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 11, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">miserae mentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:9:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 9, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">miserarum rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:614" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 7, 614</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nescio quo miserae turbine mentis agor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:9:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 9, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Gradivi,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>tumult of war</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:11:101" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 11, 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtutem turbine nullo Fortuna excutiet tibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:243" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 243</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horum mala, turbo quīs rerum imminet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Agam. 196" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Agam. 196</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49452.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a spinning-top</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whipping-top</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:378 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 378 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:5:3" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 5, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49452.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of things that have the shape or whirling motion of a top, as a <hi rend="ital">reel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whirl</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spindle</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:18:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fat. 18, 42</bibl>; Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 1, 449</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:17:7" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 17, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:315" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 315</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:336" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 336</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 10, 7, § 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:130" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 36, 61, § 130</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:14" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 4, 5, § 14</bibl>; 36, 13, 19, § 90; 37, 4, 15, § 56.—</sense><sense id="n49452.5" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A whirling motion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a whirl</hi>, <hi rend="ital">twirl</hi>, <hi rend="ital">twist</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rotation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">revolution</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a round</hi>, <hi rend="ital">circle</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">cum caeli turbine ferri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:624" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 624</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lunae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:632" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 632</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:640" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 640</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:573" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 573</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">teli (contorti),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 594</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 284</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:465" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 465</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:542" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 542</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">saxi,</quote> <trans><tr>whirling force</tr>, <tr>circular hurling</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:531" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 531</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">serpentis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the coiling</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:191" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 191</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aegaeus,</quote> <trans><tr>whirlpool</tr>, <tr>vortex</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Laud. Stil. 1, 287</bibl></cit>; so, rapax, Stat <pb n="1918" /> <cb n="TURD" /> Th. 4, 813: <cit><quote lang="la">verterit hunc (servum in emancipatione) dominus, momento turbinis exit Marcus Dama,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of whirling round</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:78" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 78</bibl></cit>: militiae turbine factus eques, i. e. <hi rend="ital">through the round of military gradation</hi> or <hi rend="ital">promotion</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:15:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 15, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulgi,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a throng</tr>, <tr>crowd</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> II. Cons. Stil. 200</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n49453" type="main" key="Turbo3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Turbo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n49453.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a gladiator</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:310" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 310</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
turbor: <entryFree id="n49454" type="main" key="turbor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">turbor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. turbo</etym>, <sense id="n49454.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">restlessness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unquietness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disturbance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tumult</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 1:15" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 1, 15</bibl>, n. 149; 2, 1 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></sense></entryFree>
turbula: <entryFree id="n49455" type="main" key="turbu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">turbŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>turba</etym>, <sense id="n49455.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a disorderly group</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a little crowd</hi> of people (Appuleian): <cit><quote lang="la">turbulae complent totas plateas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 260, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">11</bibl>, p. 159, 27; 4, p. 151, 39.</sense></entryFree>
turbulente: <entryFree id="n49456" type="main" key="turbu^lente_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">turbŭlentē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. turbulentus <sense id="n49456.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
turbulenter: <entryFree id="n49457" type="main" key="turbu^lenter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">turbŭlenter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>turbulentus</etym>, <sense id="n49457.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in a turbulent manner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">confusedly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tumultuously</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil turbulenter, nihil temere facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:16:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 16, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
turbulentia: <entryFree id="n49458" type="main" key="turbu^lenti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">turbŭlentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n49458.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">trouble</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disquiet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">turbulence</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Prax. 29 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> adv. Herm. 41</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
turbulento: <entryFree id="n49459" type="main" key="turbu^lento"><orth extent="full" lang="la">turbŭlento</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n49459.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to trouble</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disturb</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">me strepitu turbulentant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 222, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2</bibl>, p. 120, 9.</sense></entryFree>
turbulentus: <entryFree id="n49460" type="main" key="turbu^lentus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">turbŭlentus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>turba</etym>, <sense id="n49460.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of trouble</hi> or <hi rend="ital">commotion.</hi> </sense><sense id="n49460.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">restless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">agitated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">confused</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disturbed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">boisterous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stormy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tempestuous</hi> (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn. tumultuosus): tempestas,</quote> <trans><tr>stormy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:10:section=26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 10, § 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:4:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 4, 143</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">Auct. B. Alex. 45, 2: loci Neptunii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aqua,</quote> <trans><tr>turbid</tr>, <tr>muddy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">atomorum turbulenta concursio,</quote> <trans><tr>confused</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:6:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 6, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">est igitur quiddam turbulentum in hominibus singulis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:35:49" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 3, 35, 49</bibl></cit> (<bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 301, 6</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">res publica,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fam. 12, 10, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">heu edepol res turbulentas!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:1:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:4:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 4, 4, 142</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea sunt et turbulenta et temeraria et periculosa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:12:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 12, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">errores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:28:70" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 28, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animi,</quote> <trans><tr>stirred up</tr>, <tr>aroused</tr>, <tr>excited</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:5:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 5, 9</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">turbulentior inde annus excepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:61:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 61, 1</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">turbulentissimum tempus (opp. tranquillissimum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:15:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 15, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49460.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">making trouble</hi>, <hi rend="ital">troublesome</hi>, <hi rend="ital">turbulent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">factious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seditious</hi>: turba plerumque est turbulenta, Varr. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:11:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 11, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">P. Decius fuit ut vita sic oratione etiam turbulentus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:28:108" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 28, 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">seditiosus civis et turbulentus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:11:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 11, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turbulenti et mali cives,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 31, 135</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tribuni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 3, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:39" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 13, 39</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilia Antonii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 15, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">minae populi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:20:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 20, 8</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tribuni plebis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:16" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 16</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">turbŭlen-tē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in a turbulent manner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">confusedly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tumultuously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">boisterously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with violence</hi> (cf. also turbulenter). </sense><sense id="n49460.3" n="(a)" level="5"> Form turbulente: <cit><quote lang="la">qui non turbulente humana patiantur,</quote> <trans><tr>without agitation</tr>, <tr>composedly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:28:60" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 28, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se gerere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:19:28:section=3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 19, 28, § 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49460.4" n="(b)" level="5"> Form turbulenter: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil turbulenter, nihil temere facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:16:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 16, 7</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">egit de Caepione turbulentius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:30:105" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. Or. 30, 105</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">regere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 2, 13 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
