turbystum: <entryFree id="n49461" type="hapax" key="turbystum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">turbystum</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">turbistum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n49461.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a drug used by painters to facilitate the reception of a color</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a mordant</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">scytatum atque turbystum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 5, 26, § 88</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
turda: <entryFree id="n49462" type="main" key="turda"><orth extent="full" lang="la">turda</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. turdus.</entryFree>
turdarium: <entryFree id="n49463" type="main" key="turda_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">turdārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>turdus</etym>, <sense id="n49463.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a place where thrushes are kept</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 2</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
turdelix: <entryFree id="n49464" type="gloss" key="turdelix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">turdelix</orth>, icis; <sense id="n49464.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">of uncertain signif.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 2</bibl></cit> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
turdetani: <entryFree id="n49465" type="main" key="Turde_ta_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Turdētāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n49465.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of</hi> Hispania Baetica, near the mod. <hi rend="ital">Seville</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 6, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:17:2" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 17, 2</bibl>.—In a comic lusus verbb. with turdus (a thrush), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:2:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 1, 2, 60</bibl>. —Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Turdētānia</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the country of the Turdetani</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Turdetania</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Turdetaniam proficiscitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:17:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 17, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:39:11" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 39, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
turduli: <entryFree id="n49466" type="main" key="Turdu^li"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Turdŭli</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n49466.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people in Bœtica</hi>, <hi rend="ital">living to the east of the Turdetani</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:10:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 10, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:39:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 39, 8</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tur-dŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">relating to the Turduli</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:20:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 20, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
turdus: <entryFree id="n49467" type="main" key="turdus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">turdus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">turda</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:6:24" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 6, 24</bibl>; denied by <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 9:section=55" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 9, § 55</bibl> Müll.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:5:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> R. R. 3, 5, 6</bibl>) [cf. O. H. Germ. <cb n="TURI" /> trosca; Angl. Sax. throsle; Engl. thrush]. <sense id="n49467.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a thrush</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a fieldfare</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 25, 36, § 73</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:2:15" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 2, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:3:5:1" default="NO">3, 5, 1</bibl> sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 15, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:2:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 2, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 2, 74</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 5, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:92:1 al" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 92, 1 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n49467.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a kind of fish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a seacarp</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 11, 53, § 151</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:16:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 16, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:17:8" default="NO">8, 17, 8</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:12:23" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, 12, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:2:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 2, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tureus: <entryFree id="n49468" type="main" key="tu_re^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tūrĕus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">thūrĕus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>tus</etym>, <sense id="n49468.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of frankincense</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">solis est turea virga Sabaeis,</quote> <trans><tr>the frankincense-shrub</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 117</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">virga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:255" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 255</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">planta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:8:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 8, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">grana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:410" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 410</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dona,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:225" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 225</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">altaria,</quote> <trans><tr>on which incense is burned</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:412" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 412</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
turgeo: <entryFree id="n49469" type="main" key="turge^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">turgĕo</orth>, <itype>rsi, gēre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">sparga/w</foreign>, to swell; <foreign lang="greek">sfriga/w</foreign>, to be full; perh. Sanscr. root ūrgā, succulence; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">o)rga/w</foreign>, to swell, etc.</etym>, <sense id="n49469.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to swell out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be swollen</hi> or <hi rend="ital">tumid</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>; not in Cic.; cf. tumeo). </sense><sense id="n49469.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">si lienes turgent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 157, 7</bibl></cit>: Cyclopis venter turserat alte, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 870</bibl> P. (Ann. v. 326 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">ora (ab ictu),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:757" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 757</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lumina gemitu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:21:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 21, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mammae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 13, 51, § 141</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:6" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 6</bibl></cit> (4, 5), 27: <cit><quote lang="la">laeto in palmite gemmae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:7:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 7, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frumenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:315" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 1, 315</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">herba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:203" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 203</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caules,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 17, 37, § 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uva mero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:68:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 68, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacculus pleno ore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:138" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 138</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49469.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n49469.3" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">turgent mendacia nimiis monstris,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>are full</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Eutr. 1, 350</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(uxor) turget mihi,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>is swelling with anger</tr>, <tr>is enraged</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:5:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 5, 17</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 3, 2, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49469.4" n="B" level="2"> Of speech, <hi rend="ital">to be inflated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">turgid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bombastic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio, quae turget et inflata est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 10, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">professus grandia turget,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 27</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
turgesco: <entryFree id="n49470" type="main" key="turgesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">turgesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n49470.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [turgeo], <hi rend="ital">to begin to swell</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to swell up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">swell.</hi> </sense><sense id="n49470.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne aqua in eorum corpore turgescat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 8:9:13" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 8, 9, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc (umore) aetas illa (puerilis) turgescit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:28" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prima Ceres docuit turgescere semen in agris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:10:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 10, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">brassica valido caule, Col. poët. 10, 325: virgulta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:200" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 50, 76, § 200</bibl></cit>: hic satur irriguo mavult turgescere somno, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to grow fat</hi> or <hi rend="ital">stout</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:56" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 56</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bullatis nugis Pagina turgescit,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>is full</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 18</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n49470.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n49470.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To swell with passion</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sapientis animus numquam turgescit, numquam tumet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:9:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 9, 19</bibl></cit>: cor turgescit tristibus iris, id. poët. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 9, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">turgescit vitrea bilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:3:8" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 3, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49470.4" n="B" level="2"> Of speech, <hi rend="ital">to be inflated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">turgid</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus dicendi, quod immodico tumore turgescit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:73" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 73</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
turgidulus: <entryFree id="n49471" type="main" key="turgi^du^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">turgĭdŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n49471.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [turgidus], <hi rend="ital">swollen</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ocelli flendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 3, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
turgidus: <entryFree id="n49472" type="main" key="turgi^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">turgĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>turgeo</etym>, <sense id="n49472.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">swollen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inflated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distended</hi>, <hi rend="ital">turgid</hi> (class.; syn. tumidus). </sense><sense id="n49472.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">membrum tumidum ac turgidum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:9:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 9, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 3, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:39:8" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 39, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venter,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, p. 176, 40</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aqua subter cutem fusa turgidus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 45, 46, § 148</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haedus, Cui frons turgida cornibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:13:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 13, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loca semine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1034" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1034</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 3, 19</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fluvii hibernā nive,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 12, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vento vela,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 10, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:11:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 11, 42</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(femina),</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>pregnant</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:661" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 2, 661</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49472.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of speech, <hi rend="ital">inflated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">turgid</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">oratio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Alpinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:10:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 10, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alto fastu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Laud. Stil. 2, 158</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
turgor: <entryFree id="n49473" type="main" key="turgor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">turgor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n49473.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a swelling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">turgidity</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 2, § 135</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, § 566</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
turia: <entryFree id="n49474" type="main" key="Tu_ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tūrĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n49474.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river in</hi> Hispania Tarraconensis, now <hi rend="ital">the Turia</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Guadalaviar</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:6:6" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 6, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 2:96:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 2, 96, 6</bibl> Dietsch; 2, 18 ib.—Called also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tūrĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 3, 4, § 20</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tūrĭensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to Turia</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">proelium (in the Sertorian war),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 2, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
turianus: <entryFree id="n49475" type="main" key="Tu^ri^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tŭrĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Turius.</entryFree>
turibulum: <entryFree id="n49476" type="main" key="tu_ri^bu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tūrĭbŭlum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">thūr-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>tus</etym>. <sense id="n49476.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a vessel to burn incense in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a censer</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:21:section=46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 21, § 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:14:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 14, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:9:23" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 9, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 3</bibl>, ext. 1; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 12, 104</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Apoth. 479</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49476.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a constellation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">otherwise called</hi> Ara, <bibl default="NO"><author>German.</author> Arat. 390</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
turicremus: <entryFree id="n49477" type="main" key="tu_ri^cre^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tūrĭcrĕmus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">thūr-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>tuscremo</etym>, <sense id="n49477.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">incense-burning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">for burning incense</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">arae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:353" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 353</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:453" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 453</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">foci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 2, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:989" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 989</bibl></cit>. <cb n="TURP" /></sense></entryFree>
turifer: <entryFree id="n49478" type="main" key="tu_ri^fe^r"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tūrĭfĕr</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">thūr-</orth>), <itype>fĕra, fĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>tusfero</etym>, <sense id="n49478.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">incense-bearing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that bears</hi>, <hi rend="ital">yields</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">produces incense</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Indus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:720" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 720</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 23, 26, § 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sabaei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:138" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 138</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Arabes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> III. Cons. Hon. 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">silvae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rapt. Pros. 2, 81</bibl></cit>: grex, <hi rend="ital">that offers frankincense</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">idolaters</hi>, <hi rend="ital">heathen</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Apoth. 359</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
turificator: <entryFree id="n49479" type="main" key="tu_ri^fi^ca_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tūrĭfĭcātor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">thūr-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>turifico</etym>, <sense id="n49479.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one that offers incense</hi> to the gods, i. e. <hi rend="ital">an idolater</hi>, Aug. contr. Liter. Petil. c. 103.</sense></entryFree>
turifico: <entryFree id="n49480" type="main" key="tu_ri^fi^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tūrĭfĭco</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>tus-facio</etym>, <sense id="n49480.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to burn incense</hi>, <hi rend="ital">offer incense</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 87:2" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 87, 2</bibl>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">tūrĭfĭcātus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">thūr-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">one that offers incense</hi> (to the gods), a term applied to those Christians who sacrificed to the heathen gods in time of persecution, Cyprian. Ep. 55.</sense></entryFree>
turilegus: <entryFree id="n49481" type="hapax" key="tu_ri^le^gus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tūrĭlĕgus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>tus-lego</etym>, <sense id="n49481.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">incense-gathering</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Arabes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:569" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 569</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
turio: <entryFree id="n49482" type="main" key="turi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">turĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n49482.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a shoot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sprout</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tendril</hi>, <hi rend="ital">young branch</hi> of a tree, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:50:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 50, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:8:1" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 8, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
turium: <entryFree id="n49483" type="main" key="Turi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Turĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, v. Turia.</entryFree>
turius: <entryFree id="n49484" type="main" key="Tu^ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tŭrĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n49484.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Roman</hi> gens. </sense><sense id="n49484.1" n="I" level="1"> Q. Turius, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:26:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 26, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49484.2" n="II" level="1"> C. Turius, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:1:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 1, 49</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tŭrĭ-ānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a Turius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Turian</hi>: hereditas, <hi rend="ital">of Q. Turius</hi>, Cic Fam. 12, 26, 2: <cit><quote lang="la">cassia, a peculiar kind so called,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:39:4:16:section=7" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 39, 4, 16, § 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
turma: <entryFree id="n49485" type="main" key="turma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">turma</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>Sanscr. root tvar-, tur-, hasten; v. turba</etym>, a division of Roman cav alry, the tenth part of an ala, consisting at first of thirty, and afterwards of thirty-two men; <sense id="n49485.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a troop</hi>, <hi rend="ital">squadron</hi> of horse. </sense><sense id="n49485.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:16:26" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, 16, 26</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 2, 14</bibl>; Fest p. 355; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 33</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 45</bibl>; 7, 80, 7, 88; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:19" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:21:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 21, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 15, 4, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:16:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 16, 22</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 190 al.</bibl>; cf. Becker, Antiq. 3, 2, p. 258 sq.—</sense><sense id="n49485.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">a troop</hi>, <hi rend="ital">crowd</hi>, <hi rend="ital">throng</hi>, <hi rend="ital">band</hi>, <hi rend="ital">body</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in turmā inauratarum equestrium (statuarum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 1, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">immanis Titanum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:4:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 4, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Iliae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,002:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> C. S. 38</bibl></cit>: cristatae exercitus. <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> III. Cons. Hon. 133</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> in Ruf. 2, 343</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Alexan dri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">feminea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:10:51" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 10, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Gallica,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of priests of Isis</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:13:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 13, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
turmalis: <entryFree id="n49486" type="main" key="turma_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">turmālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>turma</etym>, <sense id="n49486.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belong ing to a troop</hi> or <hi rend="ital">squadron.</hi> </sense><sense id="n49486.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">turmāles</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>: T. Manlius cum suis turmalibus evasit, i. e. <hi rend="ital">with those of his squadron</hi> or <hi rend="ital">troop</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 7, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:18:11" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 18, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49486.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">non sanguine cretus Turmali trabeāque Remi,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of the equestrian order</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:2:17" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 2, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">buccina,</quote> <trans><tr>a cav alry-trumpet</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> B. Gild. 447</bibl></cit>.—In a pun Scipio ille major Corinthiis statuam pollicentibus eo loco, ubi aliorum essent impe ratorum, turmales dixit displicere, i. e <hi rend="ital">horsemen</hi>, and also <hi rend="ital">crowds</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:65:262" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 65, 262</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi> adverb.: <cit><quote lang="la">Bellona mixta viris turmale fremit,</quote> <trans><tr>like a whole squadron</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:10" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
turmarii: <entryFree id="n49487" type="main" key="turma_ri^i"><orth extent="full" lang="la">turmārĭi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n49487.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">recruiting officers of cavalry</hi>, Cod. Th. 6, 35, 3.</sense></entryFree>
turmatim: <entryFree id="n49488" type="main" key="turma_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">turmātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n49488.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">by troops</hi> or <hi rend="ital">squadrons</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">equites se turmatim explicare coeperunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostri turmatim in eum devenerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:18" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vagantibus circa moenia turmatim barbaris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:39:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 39, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">abire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:13:9 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 13, 9 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n49488.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">in troops</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in bands</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora turmatim certantia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 118</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
turnus: <entryFree id="n49489" type="main" key="Turnus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Turnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n49489.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A king of the Rutuli</hi>, <hi rend="ital">killed by Æneas</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 2, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:344 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 344 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:451 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 451 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:5:48" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 5, 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:54" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 54</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Turni lacus, i. e. lacus Juturnae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:138" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 138</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49489.1" n="II" level="1"> Turnus Herdonius, <hi rend="ital">a Latin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the enemy of Tarquinius Superbus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 50</bibl> sqq.</sense></entryFree>
turones: <entryFree id="n49490" type="main" key="Tu^ro^nes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tŭrŏnes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n49490.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people in</hi> Gallia Lugdunensis, <hi rend="ital">on the Liger</hi>, near the site of the mod. <hi rend="ital">Tours</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 35</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 18, 32, § 107</bibl>.—Called afterwards <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tŭrŏ-ni</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tŭrŏnĭi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 75</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:46" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 46</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 11, 12</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tŭrŏnĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Turones</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Turonic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ecclesiae episcopatus,</quote> <trans><tr>of Tours</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sulp.</author> Sev. Vit. S. Mart. 9</bibl></cit>.—<orth extent="full" lang="la">Tŭrŏnĭcensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, Ven. Misc. 8, 21.</sense></entryFree>
turpiculus: <entryFree id="n49491" type="main" key="turpi^cu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">turpĭcŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n49491.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [turpis], <hi rend="ital">ugly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">foul</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deformed.</hi> </sense><sense id="n49491.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: nasus, Cat. <pb n="1919" /> <cb n="TURP" /> 41, 3: <cit><quote lang="la">res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=97" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 97</bibl></cit> Müll.—* </sense><sense id="n49491.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">jocus in (rebus) turpiculis et quasi deformibus ponitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:61:248" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 61, 248</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
turpido: <entryFree id="n49492" type="main" key="turpi_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">turpīdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>contr. from turpidudo</etym>, <sense id="n49492.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">baseness</hi>, etc., <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Cor. Mil. 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:2:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 2, 2</bibl> MSS. (B. and K. turpitudinis; cf. Osann ad loc.).</sense></entryFree>
turpificatus: <entryFree id="n49493" type="hapax" key="turpi^fi^ca_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">turpĭfĭcātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>turpisfacio</etym>, <sense id="n49493.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">made foul</hi> or <hi rend="ital">filthy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">debased</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deformed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">corrupted;</hi> trop.: foeditas turpificati animi. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:29:105" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 29, 105</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
turpilius: <entryFree id="n49494" type="main" key="Turpi^li^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Turpĭlĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>; <orth extent="full" lang="la">Turpĭlĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n49494.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Roman</hi> gens. So, Sex. Turpilius, <hi rend="ital">a Roman comic poet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a contemporary and friend of Terence</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:22:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 22, 1</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:34:72" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 34, 72</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Fem.</hi> Turpilia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
turpiloquium: <entryFree id="n49495" type="main" key="turpi^lo^qui^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">turpĭlŏquĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>turpis-loquor</etym>, <sense id="n49495.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">obscene</hi> or <hi rend="ital">immodest speech</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pud. 17 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Fid. 5, 10, § 110</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
turpilucricupidus: <entryFree id="n49496" type="hapax" key="turpi^lu^cri_^cu^pi^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">turpĭlŭcrī^cŭpĭdus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <sense id="n49496.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. m.</hi> [turpis-lucrum-cupidus], = <foreign lang="greek">aisxrokerdh/s</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">covetous of base</hi> or <hi rend="ital">dishonest gain</hi>, as a term of abuse, Plaut Trin. 1, 2, 63.</sense></entryFree>
turpilucrus: <entryFree id="n49497" type="hapax" key="turpi^lu^crus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">turpĭlŭcrus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <sense id="n49497.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. m.</hi> [turpis-iucrum], <hi rend="ital">making dishonest gain</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Op. Mon. 13" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Op. Mon. 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
turpio: <entryFree id="n49498" type="main" key="Turpi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Turpĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, v. Ambivius.</entryFree>
turpis: <entryFree id="n49499" type="main" key="turpis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">turpis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>Sanscr. root tarp-, to be ashamed</etym>, <sense id="n49499.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">ugly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unsightly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unseemly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">foul</hi>, <hi rend="ital">filthy</hi> (class.; esp. freq. in a trop. sense; syn.: taeter, foedus, deformis, obscaenus, immundus). </sense><sense id="n49499.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aspectus deformis atque turpis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:35:126" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 35, 126</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 125</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ornatus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 2, 94</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">infra, II.: vestitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:2:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 2, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">colores foedā specie,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:421" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 421</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">podex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:8:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 8, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rana,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 3, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viri morbo,</quote> <trans><tr>deformed</tr>, <tr>disfigured</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:37:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 1, 37, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">macies,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 27, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scabies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:441" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 441</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">podagrae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 299</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">udo membra flmo,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>befouled</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:358" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 5, 358</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">toral,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 5, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:36:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 36, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:79:2" default="NO">8, 79, 2</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: simia quam similis turpissima bestia nobis, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:35:97" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 35, 97</bibl> (Sat. v. 45 Vahl.)—</sense><sense id="n49499.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of sound, <hi rend="ital">disagreeable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cacophonous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si etiam abfugit turpe visum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:47:158" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 47, 158</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49499.3" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">unseemly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shameful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disgraceful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">base</hi>, <hi rend="ital">infamous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scandalous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dishonorable</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">inhonestus, impurus, sordidus, indecorus): pulchrum ornatum turpes mores pejus caeno collinunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 3, 133</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:4:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 4, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum esset proposita aut fuga turpis aut gloriosa mors,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:30:97" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 30, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mors honesta saepe vitam quoque turpem exornat, at vita turpis saepe ne morti quidem honestae locum relinquit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 15, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adulescentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:15:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Font. 15, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 1, 6, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">luxuria cum omni aetati turpis, tum senectuti foedissima est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:34:123" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 34, 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si enim disserunt, nihil esse obscenum, nihil turpe dictu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:22:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 22, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque rogemus res turpes, nec faciamus rogati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:12:40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 12, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">formido mortis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:3:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars ingentem formidine turpi Scandunt equum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:400" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 400</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">repulsa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turpem senectam Degere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:31:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 1, 31, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adulter,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 33, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">meretricis amor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 4, 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non turpis ad te, sed miser confugit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 31, 98</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:11:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 11, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">prodis ex judice Dama Turpis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub dominā meretrice turpis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Egestas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:276" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 276</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fama,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil turpe est, cujus placet pretium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 95:33" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 95, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">luxus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:298" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 298</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fames,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:5:3" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">foedus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:6:7" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 6, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">metus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:9:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 9, 8</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid hoc turpius? quid foedius?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:34:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 34, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid est autem nequius aut turpius effeminato viro?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:17:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 17, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil est turpius quam cum eo bellum gerere, quocum familiariter vixeris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:21:77" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 21, 77</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">26, 99</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 2</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo turpissimus atque inhonestissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:18:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 18, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iste omnium turpissimus et sordidissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 9, 9, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turpissima fuga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 31</bibl></cit>: turpissimus calumniae quaestus, Crassus ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:55:226" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 55, 226</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod quidem mihi videtur esse turpissimum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:4:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 4, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49499.4" n="b" level="4"> As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">turpĕ</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a base</hi> or <hi rend="ital">shameful thing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a disgrace</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shame</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reproach</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec honesto quicquam honestius, nec turpi turpius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:27:75" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 27, 75</bibl></cit>: turpe senex miles, turpe senilis amor. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 9, 4</bibl>: honesta et turpia <cb n="TURR" /> virtutis ac malitiae societas efficit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 31:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 31, 5</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">turpe incedere,</quote> <trans><tr>in an unsightly manner</tr>, <tr>unbecomingly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:42:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 42, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gemens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:334" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 3, 334</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49499.5" n="c" level="4"> Turpe est, or simply turpe, with a <hi rend="ital">subj.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">habere quaestui rem publicam, non modo turpe est, sed sceleratum etiam et nefarium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:22:77" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 22, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod facere non turpe est, modo, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 35, 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">benevolentiam adsentando colligere turpe est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:17:61" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 17, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid autem turpius quam illudi?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 26, 99</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 21, 77</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">turpe erit, ingenium mitius esse feris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:10:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 10, 26</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">turpe ducet cedere pari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:22" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 2, 22</bibl></cit>.— <itype>Hence</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">turpĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in an ugly</hi> or <hi rend="ital">unsightly manner.</hi> </sense><sense id="n49499.6" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (so rare): <cit><quote lang="la">ut turpiter atrum Desinat in piscem mulier formosa superne,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">claudicare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:17:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 17, 20</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49499.7" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">in an unseemly manner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">basely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shamefully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dishonorably</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">turpiter et nequiter facere aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:17:36" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 17, 36</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">unum illud extimescebam, ne quid turpiter facerem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 9, 7, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turpiter se in castra recipere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me turpiter hodie hic dabo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:1:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 1, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 4, 4, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 3, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 2, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 80</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 24</bibl>; Auct. B. G. 8, 13; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:284" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 284</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 187</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:25:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 25, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:7:15" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 7, 15</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:6:13" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 6, 13</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:12:29" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 12, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 82:12" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 82, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
turpiter: <entryFree id="n49500" type="main" key="turpi^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">turpĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. turpis <sense id="n49500.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
turpitudo: <entryFree id="n49501" type="main" key="turpi^tu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">turpĭtūdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>turpis</etym>, <sense id="n49501.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">ugliness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unsightliness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">foulness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deformity</hi> (syn. deformitas). </sense><sense id="n49501.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">an est ullum malum majus turpitudine?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:29:105" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 29, 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtutis laude turpitudinem tegere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 283, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49501.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">baseness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shamefulness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disgrace</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dishonor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">infamy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">turpitude</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">obscenitas, dedecus): ut nullum probrum, nullum facinus, nulla turpitudo ab accusatore obiceretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:16:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Font. 16, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quanta erit turpitudo, quantum dedecus, quanta labes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:7:5:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 7, 5, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turpitudinem atque infamiam delere ac tollere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:16:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 1, 16, 49</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:11:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 11, 38</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si omnia fugiendae turpitudinis adipiscendaeque honestatis causā faciemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:27:66" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 27, 66</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fuga turpitudinis, appetentia laudis et honestatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:2:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(divitiis) abuti per turpitudinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 13, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum summā turpitudine in exsilio aetatem agere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 58:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 58, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">populo turpitudinem et impudentiam exprobrare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:42" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:59:242" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 59, 242</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut turpitudinem fugae virtute delerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">generis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:7:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 7, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pristinae vitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:3:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 3, 3</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">propter flagitiorum ac turpitudinum societatem,</quote> <trans><tr>fellowship in vile practices</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:41:section=107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 41, § 107</bibl></cit>; v. also turpido.</sense></entryFree>
turpo: <entryFree id="n49502" type="main" key="turpo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">turpo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n49502.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make ugly</hi> or <hi rend="ital">unsightly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to soil</hi>, <hi rend="ital">defile</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pollute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disfigure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deform</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>; cf. deformo). </sense><sense id="n49502.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: Jovis aram sanguine turpari, <hi rend="ital">to be defiled</hi> or <hi rend="ital">polluted</hi>, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:35:85" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 35, 85</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 19, 45</bibl> (Trag. v. 125 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">sanguine capillos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:832" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 832</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">canitiem pulvere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 611</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frontem (cicatrix),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 61</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">candidos umeros (rixae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:13:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 1, 13, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ora (pallor),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:631" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 631</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te quia rugae Turpant et capitis nives,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:13:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 13, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsos (scabies),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Herculea turpatus gymnade vultus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th 4, 106</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49502.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to dishonor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disgrace</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ornamenta, Cic. Fragm. ap. Hier Ep. 66, 7: avos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:8:433" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 8, 433</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">afflictos Argos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 437</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
turranius: <entryFree id="n49503" type="main" key="Turra_ni^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Turrānĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n49503.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Roman</hi> gens, esp., </sense><sense id="n49503.1" n="I" level="1"> D. Turranius Niger, <hi rend="ital">a friend of Varro and of Q. Cicero</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2</bibl>, praef. § 6; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 6, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 9, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 1, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49503.2" n="II" level="1"> M. Turranius, <hi rend="ital">a prœtor</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:10:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 3, 10, 25</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49503.3" n="III" level="1"> C. Turranius, praefectus annonae, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 31</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49503.4" n="IV" level="1"> Turranius, <hi rend="ital">a tragic poet</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:16:29" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 16, 29</bibl>.—Deriv.: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Turrānĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a Turranius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Turranian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pira, a peculiar kind so called,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:10:18" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 10, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 15, 16, § 54</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 15 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
turricula: <entryFree id="n49504" type="main" key="turri^cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">turrĭcŭla</orth>. <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>turris</etym>. <sense id="n49504.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A little tower</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a turret</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 19 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n49504.1" n="II" level="1"> = pyrgus, <hi rend="ital">a kind of dice-box</hi>, shaped like a tower, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:16" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 16</bibl> <hi rend="ital">in lemm.</hi></sense></entryFree>
turriger: <entryFree id="n49505" type="main" key="turri^ger"><orth extent="full" lang="la">turrĭger</orth>, gĕra. gĕrum. <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>turris-gero</etym>, <sense id="n49505.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">turret-bearing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">turreted.</hi> </sense><sense id="n49505.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">umeri elephantorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 2, 1, § 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferae moles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:9" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 9</bibl></cit>, <cb n="TUSC" /> 560: <cit><quote lang="la">urbes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:253" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 253</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ripae, Claud. Cons. Prob. et Olybr. 229: Antemnae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:631" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 631</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:514" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 514</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:226" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 226</bibl>.—Of a city: <cit><quote lang="la">patriae imago turrigero canos effundens vertice crines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:188" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 188</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49505.2" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tur-rĭgĕra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj. f.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">turret - crowned</hi>, <hi rend="ital">turreled</hi>, an epithet of Cybele, who was represented with a crown of turrets (personifying the earth and its cities): <cit><quote lang="la">Cybele,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:321" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 321</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:224" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 224</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ops,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 2, 24</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
turris: <entryFree id="n49506" type="greek" key="turris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">turris</orth>, <itype>is</itype> (<case>acc.</case> turrim and turrem; <case>abl.</case> turri and turre; v. Neue, Formenl. I. 196 sqq.), <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">tu/rris</foreign>. <sense id="n49506.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n49506.1" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a tower</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eā ballistā si pervortam turrim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:4:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 4, 59</bibl></cit>: apud vetustam turrem, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 761</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">Dionysius contionari ex turri altā solebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:20:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 20, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in omni turre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:14" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">celsae graviore casu Decidunt turres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:10:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 10, 11</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">altae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:17:70" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 17, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Dardanae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:6:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 4, 6, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aënea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:19:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 19, 27</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49506.2" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a military tower</hi>, for defence of a camp or the walls of a city: <cit><quote lang="la">turrim in praecipiti stantem Adgressi ferro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:460" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 460</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 40</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov. Cons. 2, 4</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">for attack in a siege,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 15, 4, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:17:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 17, 17</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">on the backs of elephants,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:40:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 40, 4</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">on a ship,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:24:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 24, 6</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n49506.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n49506.4" n="A" level="2"> For any high building, <hi rend="ital">a castle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">palace</hi>, <hi rend="ital">citadel</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pauperum tabernas Regumque turres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 4, 14</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">regia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Maecenatiana,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maris vastum prospectet turribus aequor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:7:19" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 7, 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49506.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A dove-cot</hi> built in the form of a tower, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:3:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 3, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:6:51" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 6, 51</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49506.6" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of battlearray</hi> when the troops were arranged in a square, Cato ap. Fest. s. v. serra, p. 344 Müll.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:9:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 9, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
turritus: <entryFree id="n49507" type="main" key="turri_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">turrītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>turris</etym>, <sense id="n49507.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">set</hi>, <hi rend="ital">furnished</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">fortified with towers</hi>, <hi rend="ital">towered</hi>, <hi rend="ital">turreted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">castled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">castellated</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>). </sense><sense id="n49507.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n49507.2" n="A" level="2"> Moenia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:8:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 8, 47</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">muri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:4:105" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 3, 4, 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">castella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puppes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:693" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 693</bibl></cit>: elephanti, Auct. B. Afr. 30, 2; 41, 2; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 7, 7, § 22</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">inde boves Lucas turrito corpore tetros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1301" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1301</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">called turrita moles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:9:239" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 9, 239</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">turriger: tempora murali cinctus turrita coronā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:366" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 13, 366</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49507.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Turrīta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj. f.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tower-crowned</hi>, <hi rend="ital">turreted</hi>, an epithet of Cybele (v. turriger, II.): <cit><quote lang="la">dea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 11, 52: <cit><quote lang="la">Berecyntia mater,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:785" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 785</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mater,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:696" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 696</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:219 sq" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 219 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 5, 13</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49507.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">tower-shaped</hi>, <hi rend="ital">towering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">high</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lofly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">scopuli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:536" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 536</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corona,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a lofly head-dress</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:358" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 358</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Psych. 183</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vertex,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 130, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tursio: <entryFree id="n49508" type="main" key="tursi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tursĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n49508.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of fish resembling the dolphin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a porpoise</hi>: Delphinus phocaena, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 9, 11, § 34</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
turtur: <entryFree id="n49509" type="main" key="turtur"><orth extent="full" lang="la">turtur</orth>, <itype>ŭris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (<sense id="n49509.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fem.</hi> turturis marinae os, Dict Cret. 6, 15; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 8, 21, § 68</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">a turtle-dove</hi>: Columba turtur, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 34, 52, § 105</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:8" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:1:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 1, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 1, 1, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:2:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 2, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 1, 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:6:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 6, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:60:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 60, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:53:1" default="NO">13, 53, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:39" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 39</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
turturilla: <entryFree id="n49510" type="hapax" key="turtu_rilla"><orth extent="full" lang="la">turtūrilla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>turtur</etym>, <sense id="n49510.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little turtle-dove;</hi> a term applied to an effeminate person, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 96:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 96, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
turunda: <entryFree id="n49511" type="main" key="turunda"><orth extent="full" lang="la">turunda</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <sense id="n49511.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A ball of paste</hi> for fattening geese, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 89</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:9:20" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 9, 20</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49511.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of sacrificial cake</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 552, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49511.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A tent</hi> or <hi rend="ital">roll of lint</hi> for wounds, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 157, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 201" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 201</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tus: <entryFree id="n49512" type="main" key="tu_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tūs</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">thūs</orth>), <itype>tūris</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>from <foreign lang="greek">qu/os, to/</foreign></etym> <sense id="n49512.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">incense</hi>, <hi rend="ital">frankincense.</hi> </sense><sense id="n49512.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 14, 30, § 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 2, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 89</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:5:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 5, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">accendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:35:section=77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 35, § 77</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:20:80" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 20, 80</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:327" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 327</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:481" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 481</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:8:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> E. 8, 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:3:34" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 3, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:7:53" default="NO">1, 7, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:10" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 10</bibl> (4, 9), 19; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:30:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 30, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 36, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 1, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">irrita tura tulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:589" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 589</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">centumque Sabaeo Ture calent arae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:417" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 417</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 1, 57</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49512.2" n="II" level="1"> Tug terrae, <hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">called also</hi> chamaepitys, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 6, 20, § 29</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tusce: <entryFree id="n49513" type="main" key="Tusce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tuscē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>Tuscus</etym>, <sense id="n49513.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in the Tuscar language</hi> or <hi rend="ital">manner</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:7:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 11, 7, 4</bibl></cit> cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 2:25:8" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> ib. 2, 25, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tusci: <entryFree id="n49514" type="main" key="Tusci"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tusci</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Thusci</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, another name for Etrusci, <sense id="n49514.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Etru</hi> <pb n="1920" /> <cb n="TUSS" /> <hi rend="ital">ria</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Tuscans</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Etruscans</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Etrurians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:4:2" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 4, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:51:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 51, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:33:7" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 33, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:45:4" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 45, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:51:106 al" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 51, 106 al.</bibl>—Hence, </sense><sense id="n49514.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tuscĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">Etruria</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Etruscan territory</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 3, 9</bibl>;
