<bibl default="NO">7, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:5:5" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 5, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49514.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tuscus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Tuscans</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Tuscan</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Etruscan</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Etrurian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:3" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 3</bibl></cit>. 3 sq.; 2, 4, 1; 2, 7, 17; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 8, § 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:19:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 19, 69</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:33:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 33, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 202 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aequora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:4:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 4, 4, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pelagus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:5:1" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:203" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 88, 89, § 203</bibl></cit>: amnis, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the Tiber</hi>, which flows through Etruria, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:386" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 386</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">flumen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:615" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 14, 615</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alveus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:7:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 7, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tragoediae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=55" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 55</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">sacra, Col. poët. 10, 341: dux,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Mezentius</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:884" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 884</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eques,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Mœcenas</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:56:9" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 56, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cadi,</quote> <trans><tr>Tuscan wine</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:118:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 13, 118, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semen zea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,003:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Med. Fac. 65</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 8, 19, § 82</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vicus,</quote> <trans><tr>a street in Rome inhabited by low people</tr>, <tr>especially by prostitutes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=46" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 46</bibl></cit> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:14:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 14, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 65 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 4, 1, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:228 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 228 al.</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">hence, ex Tusco modo dotem corpore quaerere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:2:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 2, 3, 20</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49514.3" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tuscānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Tuscans</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Tuscan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dispositiones,</quote> <trans><tr>of the Tuscan style of architecture</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 4, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n49514.4" n="D" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tuscā-nĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Tuscans</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Tuscan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">impluvium,</quote> <trans><tr>in the Tuscan style</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=161" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 161</bibl></cit> Müll.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 3, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 7</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 12, 45, § 154</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:178" default="NO" valid="yes">36, 23, 56, § 178</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">signa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 7, 16, § 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Apollo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 7, 18, § 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statuae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 1</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n49514.5" n="E" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tuscĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the country of the Tuscans</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Tuscia</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 27, 3, 1</bibl> (but in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=32" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 32</bibl>, the correct read. is Tusci).</sense></entryFree>
tusculanensis: <entryFree id="n49515" type="main" key="Tuscu^la_nensis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tuscŭlānensis</orth>, e; <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tuscŭlā-num</orth>, i; and, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tuscŭlānus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, um; v. 2. Tusculum.</entryFree>
tusculum: <entryFree id="n49516" type="hapax" key="tuscu^lum1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tuscŭlum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">thusc-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>tus</etym>, <sense id="n49516.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little frankincense</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:8:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 8, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n49517" type="main" key="Tuscu^lum2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tuscŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n49517.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a very ancient town of Latium</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on a hill near the modern Frascati</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:15 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 15 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:33" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 33</bibl> sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:18:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Font. 18, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:43:98" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 43, 98</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 45, 94</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:1:29 al" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 1, 29 al.</bibl>—Hence, </sense><sense id="n49517.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tuscŭlā-nus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Tusculum</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Tusculan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=318" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 318</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">colles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aqua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:20:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 20, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">populus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=16" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 16</bibl></cit> Müll. et saep.—<hi rend="ital">Substt.</hi> </sense><sense id="n49517.2" n="a" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tuscŭ-lānum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the name of several estates at Tusculum;</hi> so <hi rend="ital">Cicero's estate there</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 1, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 5, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:23:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 23, 3</bibl>.—Hence, Tusculanae Disputationes, <hi rend="ital">the title of a work written there by Cicero.</hi>—<hi rend="ital">An estate of Cœsar</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 3, 13</bibl>.—Of <hi rend="ital">L. Crassus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:7:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 7, 24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 21, 98</bibl>.—Of <hi rend="ital">M. Crassus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 16, 3</bibl>.—Of <hi rend="ital">Lucullus</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 48, 148</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:2:7 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 2, 7 al.</bibl>—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tuscŭlānen-sis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to Tusculum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies,</quote> <trans><tr>passed at the Tusculan estate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 6, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49517.3" n="b" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tuscŭlāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Tusculum</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Tusculans</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 64</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:3:55" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, 3, 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:11:35" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 11, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:13:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 13, 31</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49517.4" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tuscŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Tusculum</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Tusculan</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> for Tusculanus): <cit><quote lang="la">tellus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:7:57" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 7, 57</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:61:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 61, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">colles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:64:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 64, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moenia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:692" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 692</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">umbra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:4:16" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 4, 16</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur. subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tuscŭli</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Tusculum</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Tusculans</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:31:11" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 31, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tuscus: <entryFree id="n49518" type="main" key="Tuscus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tuscus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Tusci, B.</entryFree>
tussedo: <entryFree id="n49519" type="hapax" key="tusse_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tussēdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>tussis</etym>, <sense id="n49519.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cough</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 222, 38</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tussicula: <entryFree id="n49520" type="main" key="tussi^cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tussĭcŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n49520.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little</hi> or <hi rend="ital">slight cough</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:19:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 19, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Ep. 1:2" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Ep. 1, 2 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
tussicularis: <entryFree id="n49521" type="main" key="tussi^cu^la_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tussĭcŭlāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>tussicula</etym>, <sense id="n49521.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a cough</hi>, <hi rend="ital">good for a cough</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cough-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">medicamen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 1:17:172" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 1, 17, 172</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:13:section=77" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tard. 2, 13, § 77</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">herba = tussilago,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:ib. 2:7:111" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 7, 111</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tussiculosus: <entryFree id="n49522" type="main" key="tussi^cu^lo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tussĭcŭlōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n49522.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">coughing much</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subject to a cough</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">senilis aetas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:13:90" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 13, 90</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tussicus: <entryFree id="n49523" type="main" key="tussi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tussĭcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>tussis</etym>, <sense id="n49523.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">afflicted with a cough</hi>, Firm. Math. 5, 16; <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tussiens: <entryFree id="n49524" type="main" key="tussiens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tussiens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n49524.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who has a cough</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuces tussientibus inimicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 8, 77, § 147</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:140" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 20, 83, § 140</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:42" default="NO" valid="yes">29, 3, 11, § 42</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tussilago: <entryFree id="n49525" type="main" key="tussi^la_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tussĭlāgo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n49525.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the herb colt'sfoot</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 6, 16, § 30</bibl>. <cb n="TUTE" /></sense></entryFree>
tussio: <entryFree id="n49526" type="main" key="tussi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tussĭo</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>tussis</etym>, <sense id="n49526.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cough</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to have a cough</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">forte si tussire occoeperit, ne sic tussiat, Ut cuiquam linguam in tussiendo proferat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:4:1:49 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 4, 1, 49 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">male,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crebro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:5:56" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 5, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plurimum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acerbum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:26:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 26, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tussis: <entryFree id="n49527" type="main" key="tussis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tussis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n49527.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cough</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 4, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 4, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:8:9" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 8, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:10:1 sq" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 10, 1 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 4, 51, § 136</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:140" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 20, 83, § 140</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:30" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 6, 16, § 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 132</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:44:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 44, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:497" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 497</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:9:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 9, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sicca,</quote> <trans><tr>a dry cough</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tussi liberari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 8, 29, § 92</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a severe cough</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 13, 51, § 136</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tusus: <entryFree id="n49528" type="main" key="tu_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tūsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of tundo.</entryFree>
tutaculum: <entryFree id="n49529" type="hapax" key="tu_ta_cu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tūtācŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>1. tutor</etym>, <sense id="n49529.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a defence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">means of protection</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> adv. Symm. 2, 387</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tutamen: <entryFree id="n49530" type="main" key="tu_ta_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tūtāmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n49530.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a means of defence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">defence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">protection</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">(lorica) decus et tutamen in armis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:262" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 262</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">domorum aut vestium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deposcimus rebus fessis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tutamentum: <entryFree id="n49531" type="main" key="tu_ta_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tūtāmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n49531.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a means of defence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">defence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">protection</hi> (rare; <cit><quote lang="la">not anteAug.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:61:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 61, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circumspiciens tutamenta sermonis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 105</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,023:14:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Macc. 14, 37</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tutanus: <entryFree id="n49532" type="main" key="Tu_ta_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tūtānus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n49532.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Roman guardian deity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who is fabled to have put Hannibal to flight</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 47 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; cf. Becker, Antiq. 4, p. 14; and v. Tutelina.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Titanas vobis Tutanos dicitis esse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Commod.</author> 20, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tutatio: <entryFree id="n49533" type="hapax" key="tu_ta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tūtātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n49533.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a protecting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">defending</hi>, <hi rend="ital">protection</hi>, Firm. Math. 4, 7.</sense></entryFree>
tutator: <entryFree id="n49534" type="main" key="tu_ta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tūtātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n49534.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a protector</hi>, <hi rend="ital">defender</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">periculosis tutator, egenis opitulator,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> de Deo Socr. p. 52, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tute: <entryFree id="n49535" type="main" key="tu_te^1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tūtĕ</orth>, <sense id="n49535.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pron.</hi>, v. tu, and 2. te.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n49536" type="main" key="tu_te_2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tūtē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. tueor <sense id="n49536.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
tutela: <entryFree id="n49537" type="main" key="tu_te_la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tūtēla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. tutor</etym>, <sense id="n49537.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a watching</hi>, <hi rend="ital">keeping</hi>, <hi rend="ital">charge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">care</hi>, <hi rend="ital">safeguard</hi>, <hi rend="ital">defence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">protection</hi> (syn.: praesidium, cura). </sense><sense id="n49537.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n49537.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">tutelam januae gerere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:1:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 1, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">foribus tutelam gerere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:31:1:30" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 31, 1, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suo tergo tutelam gerere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:3:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 3, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc de septis, quae tutandi causā fundi fiant dicam. Earum tutelarum genera quattuor, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:14:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 14, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecudum silvestrium,</quote> <trans><tr>care</tr>, <tr>management</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9</bibl></cit>, praef. § <cit><quote lang="la">1: boum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:2:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aselli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenuiorum,</quote> <trans><tr>support</tr>, <tr>maintenance</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:68" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lanae tutelam praestant contra frigora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 2, 9, § 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut villarum tutela non sit oneri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 18, 5, 6, § 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:14" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 3, 4, § 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">classis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:16:3:9" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 16, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum de hominis summo bono quaererent, nullam in eo neque animi neque corporis partem vacuam tutela reliquerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:14:36" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 14, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tutela ac praesidium bellicae virtutis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:10:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 10, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Apollo, cujus in tutelā Athenas antiqui historici esse voluerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:22:55" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 22, 55</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quare sit in ejus tutela Gallia, cujus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:14:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. Cons. 14, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intellegi volumus salutem hominum in ejus (Jovis) esse tutela,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:20:66" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 20, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Juno, cujus in tutelā Argi sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:24:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 24, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 2, 4, § 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">subicere aliquid tutelae alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:14:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 14, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">filios suos parvos tutelae populi commendare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:53:228" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 53, 228</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dii, quorum tutelae ea loca essent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 6, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae suae fidei tutelaeque essent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:22:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 22, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">publicae tutelae esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:19:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 42, 19, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:41:12" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 41, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">te Jovis impio Tutela Saturno Eripuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:17:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 17, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut dicar tutelā pulsa Minervae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:563" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 563</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dique deaeque omnes, quibus est tutela per agros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:13" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 13</bibl></cit> (4, 12), 41: <cit><quote lang="la">ut te generi humano, cujus tutela et securitas saluti tuae innisa est, incolumem praestarent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 52</bibl></cit> (60).— With <hi rend="ital">gen. obj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">loci,</quote> <trans><tr>protection</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:5:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 41, 5, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49537.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., jurid. t. t., <hi rend="ital">the office of a guardian</hi>, <hi rend="ital">guardianship</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wardship</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tutelage</hi> of minors, insane persons, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">tutela est, ut Servius definit, vis ac potestas in capite libero ad tuendum eum, qui propter aetatem suā sponte se defendere nequit, jure civili data ac permissa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:26:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 26, 1</bibl></cit> (De tutelis), 1: tradere aliquem in tutelam alicujus, Pac. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:46:193" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 46, 193</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in suam tutelam venire,</quote> <trans><tr>to become one's own master</tr>, <tr>come of age</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:39:180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 39, 180</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:37:11:8:section=1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 37, 11, 8, § 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:10:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 10, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:52:195" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 52, 195</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">53, 197</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:21:62" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 21, 62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:2:179" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> 2, 179</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 2, 1</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">rarely in the order, in tutelam suam venire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:42:122" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 42, 122</bibl></cit>: <cb n="TUTO" /> tutelae suae fieri, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 33:10" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 33, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fraudare pupillum, qui in tutelam pervenit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 6, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicujus tutelam accipere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:2:17" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 2, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad sanos abeat tutela propinquos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:218" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 218</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rei publicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:25:85" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 25, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tutelam filiorum servo committere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:2:5" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 4, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tutelam pupilli suscipere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:30:2:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 30, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gerere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:6:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nancisci,</quote> <trans><tr>to become guardian</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst. 1:12:6" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. 1, 12, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">administrare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:26:7:3:section=2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 26, 7, 3, § 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reddere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:1:2:section=3" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 5, 1, 2, § 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49537.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, concr. </sense><sense id="n49537.5" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, like our <hi rend="ital">watch</hi>, of that which guards or protects, <hi rend="ital">a keeper</hi>, <hi rend="ital">warder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">guardian</hi>, <hi rend="ital">protector</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">(Philemon et Baucis) templi tutela fuere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:711" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 711</bibl></cit>: prorae tutela Melanthus, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the pilot at the prow</hi>, = proreta, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:617" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 617</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">o tutela praesens Italiae (Augustus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:14:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 14, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Achilles) decus et tutela Pelasgi Nominis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:612" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 612</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum tutela mearum Cum sis (shortly before: curator a praetore datus),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 103</bibl></cit>.—Of <hi rend="ital">the image of the tutelar deity</hi> of a ship: <cit><quote lang="la">navis, cujus tutela ebore caelata est, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 76:13" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 76, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 11, 19</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:543" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 543</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 105</bibl> and 108.—Of <hi rend="ital">the tutelar deity</hi> of a place, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 57</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Priap.</author> 37</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Isa. 57, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1698 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1736</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49537.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A remedy against</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cure</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si qua est tutela podagrae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Grat.</author> Cyn. 478</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n49537.7" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>, of that which is guarded or protected, <hi rend="ital">a charge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">care.</hi> </sense><sense id="n49537.8" n="1" level="3"> In gen. (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">virginum primae puerique claris Patribus orti, Deliae tutela deae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:6:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 6, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lanuvium annosi vetus est tutela draconis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 8, 3: <cit><quote lang="la">sit, precor, tutela Minervae Navis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:10:1 sq" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 10, 1 sq.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n49537.9" n="2" level="3"> In partic., in jurid. lang., <hi rend="ital">that which is under guardianship</hi> or <hi rend="ital">tutelage</hi>: in officiis apud majores ita observatum est: primum tutelae, deinde hospiti, deinde clienti, tum cognato, postea affini, <hi rend="ital">a ward</hi>, Massur. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:13:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 13, 5</bibl>.—Of <hi rend="ital">the property of a ward</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mirabamur, te ignorare, de tutelā legitimā ... nihil usucapi posse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 5, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil potest de tutelā legitimā sine omnium tutorum auctoritate deminui,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 34, 84</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:26:7:5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 26, 7, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tutelaris: <entryFree id="n49538" type="main" key="tu_te_la_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tūtēlāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>tutela</etym> (post-class.). <sense id="n49538.0" n="I" level="1"> (Acc. to tutela, I. B.) <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to guardianship</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tutelar</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tutelary</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">causa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:3:4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 12, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">instrumenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:27:7:8" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 27, 7, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anni,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 4, 24 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praetor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> M. Aur. 19 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n49538.1" n="II" level="1"> (Acc. to tutela, II. A.) Di, <hi rend="ital">tutelar deities</hi> of places, <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 3, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 3, 114</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tutelarius: <entryFree id="n49539" type="main" key="tu_te_la_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tūtēlārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>tutela, I. A.</etym>, <sense id="n49539.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who has the care</hi> or <hi rend="ital">custody</hi> of a thing, <hi rend="ital">a keeper</hi>, <hi rend="ital">warden</hi>, <hi rend="ital">curator;</hi> of a building, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 7, 17, § 38</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">PRAETOR,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 363, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">465, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tutelator: <entryFree id="n49540" type="hapax" key="tu_te_la_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tūtēlātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>tutela</etym>, <sense id="n49540.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a protector</hi>, <hi rend="ital">guardian;</hi> said of a genius, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 2, § 152</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tutelatus: <entryFree id="n49541" type="main" key="tu_te_la_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tūtēlātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n49541.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that is under protection</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus agri (with in tutelam rei urbanae assignatum),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aggen.</author> Limit. Agr. p. 58</bibl></cit> Goes.</sense></entryFree>
tutelina: <entryFree id="n49542" type="main" key="Tu_te_li_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tūtēlīna</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tūtīlīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n49542.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a guardian deity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tutelar goddess.</hi> </sense><sense id="n49542.1" n="I" level="1"> Of Rome, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=163" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 163</bibl> Müll.; id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 247, 29</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49542.2" n="II" level="1"> Of corn, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Spect. 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 16</bibl>; Aug. Civ. Dei, 4, 8; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 1, 3, § 8</bibl>; v. Tutanus.</sense></entryFree>
tutemet: <entryFree id="n49543" type="main" key="tu_te^met"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tūtĕmet</orth>, v. tute and met.</entryFree>
tuticanus: <entryFree id="n49544" type="main" key="Tu_ti^ca_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tūtĭcānus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n49544.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a man</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:12:10 sq" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 12, 10 sq.</bibl> (where it is sportively scanned Tūtĭcănumque and Tūtĭcănui, to show that it cannot stand in elegiac verse).</sense></entryFree>
tutienses: <entryFree id="n49545" type="main" key="Tuti^enses"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tutĭenses</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n49545.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an ancient people of Latium</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 69</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tutilius: <entryFree id="n49546" type="main" key="Tuti^li^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tutĭlĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n49546.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a rhetorician of Rome</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:32:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 32, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:1:21" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 1, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:56:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 56, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tutini: <entryFree id="n49547" type="main" key="Tuti_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tutīni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n49547.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Calabria</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 11, 16, § 105</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tuto: <entryFree id="n49548" type="main" key="tu_to_1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tūtō</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. tueor, <sense id="n49548.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n49549" type="main" key="tu_to2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tūto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, v. 2. tutor <sense id="n49549.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
tutor: <entryFree id="n49550" type="main" key="tu_tor1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tūtor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>tueor</etym>, <sense id="n49550.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a watcher</hi>, <hi rend="ital">protector</hi>, <hi rend="ital">defender.</hi> </sense><sense id="n49550.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (so very rare; not in Cic.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn. defensor): et te, pater Silvane, tutor finium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:2:22" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 2, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tutorem imperii agere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tit. 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Bacchi, i. e. Priapus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 133</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49550.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n49550.3" n="A" level="2"> Jurid. t. t., <hi rend="ital">a guardian</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tutor</hi>, of minors, women, insane persons, etc. (prop. of the person; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">curator, of the estate),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst. 1:14:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. 1, 14, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:26:1:18 sq" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 26, 1, 18 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:26:2:12:section=14" default="NO">26, 2, 12, § 14</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">esse</hi> and <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tutor sum liberis (Triarii),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:28:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 28, 3</bibl></cit>: a pupillo Heio, <pb n="1921" /> <cb n="TUUS" /> cui C. Marcellus tutor est, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:17:section=37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 17, § 37</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemo illum tutorem umquam liberis suis scripsit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:14:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 14, 41</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum pupilli Malleoli tutor esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:36:section=90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 36, § 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">is casu pupilli Junii tutor erat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 50</bibl></cit>, § 132; 2, 1, 51, § 135; <cit><quote lang="la">2, 1, 53, § 139: qui tutor Philippi erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:54:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 54, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. also <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:25:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 25, 72</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:53:228" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 53, 228</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:12:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 12, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 2, 16</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 5, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:9:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 9, 7</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">orbae eloquentiae quasi tutores relicti sumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:96:330" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 96, 330</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quasi tutor et procurator rei publicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:29:51" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 29, 51</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:14:16" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 14, 16</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49550.4" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tūtor</orth>, <hi rend="ital">the title of a mimic play</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:64:259" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 64, 259</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n49551" type="main" key="tu_tor2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tūtor</orth>, <itype>ātus</itype> (<sense id="n49551.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> parag. tutarier, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:3:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 3, 41</bibl>), 1, <hi rend="ital">v. dep. a.</hi> [tueor], <hi rend="ital">to watch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">guard</hi>, <hi rend="ital">keep</hi>, <hi rend="ital">protect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">defend.</hi> </sense><sense id="n49551.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn. tueor): tutatus est domum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:196" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 196</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem eri (servus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 5, 6, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem parentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 5, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res Italas armis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genae ab inferiore parte tutantur (oculos),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:57:143" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 57, 143</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">egregiis muris situque naturali urbem tutantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Volsci vallo se tutarentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:22:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 22, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">religione sese tutabatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem publicam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:13:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 13, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:4:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 4, 1, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">provincias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 6, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">serves Tuterisque tuo fidentem praesidio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 81</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 1, 171</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quas (spes) necesse est et virtute et innocentiā tutari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 85:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 85, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">natura arbores cortice a frigoribus et calore tutata est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7</bibl></cit>, praef. § <cit><quote lang="la">2: quibus (viribus) ab irā Romanorum vestra tutaremini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:26:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 26, 1</bibl></cit>: a proximorum insidiis salutem, Val. Ant. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:8:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 8, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">locorum ingenio sese contra imbelles regis copias tutabatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adversus multitudinem hostium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:25:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 25, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut suae quisque partis tutandae reus sit,</quote> <trans><tr>responsible for its safety</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:30:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 30, 5</bibl></cit>.— * </sense><sense id="n49551.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to ward off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">avert</hi> an evil: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse praesentem inopiam quibus poterat subsidiis tutabatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 52</bibl></cit>.!*? <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">tūto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <hi rend="ital">to watch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">defend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">guard</hi>, etc.: tuos qui celsos terminos tutant, Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 476, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0116,001:ib. 13" default="NO"><author>Pac.</author> ib. 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1321,001:ib. 12" default="NO"><author>Pompon.</author> ib. 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 5, 2, 24</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n49551.3" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">tūtor</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, in <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> signif.: <cit><quote lang="la">patria et prognati tutantur et servantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc per vos tutari conservarique cupiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:21:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 21, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tutata possessio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 9:11" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 9, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tutorius: <entryFree id="n49552" type="main" key="tu_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tūtōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. tutor</etym>, <sense id="n49552.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a guardian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tutorio nomine regnum administrare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:30:3:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 30, 3, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tutrix: <entryFree id="n49553" type="main" key="tutrix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tutrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <sense id="n49553.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">f</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">a female guardian</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tutrix.</hi> </sense><sense id="n49553.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">filiarum suarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 5, 35, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49553.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of the Muses, Fulg. Myth. praef. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
tutubo: <entryFree id="n49554" type="main" key="tu_tu^bo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tūtŭbo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>onomatop.</etym>, <sense id="n49554.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cry like an owl</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to hoot</hi>: noctua lucifugax tutubat in tenebris, Auct. Carm. Philom. 41 (al. cucubat); cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:4:2:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 4, 2, 96</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tutulatus: <entryFree id="n49555" type="main" key="tu^tu^la_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tŭtŭlātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>tutulus</etym>, <sense id="n49555.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having</hi> or <hi rend="ital">wearing a</hi> tutulus, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=44" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 44</bibl> Müll.; and in Fest. s. v. tutulum, pp. 354 and 355 ib. (Ann. v. 124 Vahl.), Pompon. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 19, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tutulus: <entryFree id="n49556" type="main" key="tu^tu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tŭtŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n49556.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a high head-dress</hi>, <hi rend="ital">formed by plaiting the hair in a cone over the forehead</hi>, worn esp. by the Flamen and his wife, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=44" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 44</bibl> Müll.; Fest. pp 354 and 355 ib.; and v. Böttig. Sabina, 1, p. 132.</sense></entryFree>
tutunus: <entryFree id="n49557" type="main" key="Tu_tu_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tūtūnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, i. q. <sense id="n49557.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Priapus</hi>, Aug. Civ. Dei, 4, 11; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 4, 131</bibl> and 133.</sense></entryFree>
tutus: <entryFree id="n49558" type="main" key="tu_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tūtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos> of tueor.</entryFree>
tuus: <entryFree id="n49559" type="main" key="tu^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tŭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n49559.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pron. poss.</hi> [tu], <hi rend="ital">thy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">your</hi>, <hi rend="ital">yours.</hi> </sense><sense id="n49559.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n49559.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">tuŏs est servus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:1:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 1, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex tuā accepi manu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 132</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperium tuom,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 84</bibl></cit>: <hi rend="ital">Me.</hi> Quojus nunc es? <hi rend="ital">So.</hi> Tuos, nam pugnis usu fecisti tuom, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1, 219</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tuos sum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 7</bibl></cit> and 14: <cit><quote lang="la">vigebat auditor Panaetii illius tui Mnesarchus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:11:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 11, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de tuis unus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 16, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numquam tu ... tam longe a tot tuis et hominibus et rebus carissimis et suavissimis abesse voluisses,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tuā istuc refert, si curaveris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 109</bibl></cit> (v. refert): <hi rend="ital">Ly.</hi> Bene ego volo illi facere, si tu non nevis. <hi rend="ital">Ph.</hi> Nempe de tuo. <hi rend="ital">Ly.</hi> De meo: <cit><quote lang="la">nam quod tuomst. meumst: omne meum autem tuomst,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:47 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 47 sq.</bibl></cit>: tuae potestatis<cb n="TYMP" />  semper tu tuaque omnia sint, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:39:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 39, 21</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49559.3" n="2" level="3"> Esp.: tuum est, <hi rend="ital">it is thy part</hi>, <hi rend="ital">duty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">custom</hi>, etc.; with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud tuom istuc est vereri te,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:4:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 5, 4, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tuomst, si quid praeter spem evenit, mihi ignoscere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:1:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 1, 53</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49559.4" n="3" level="3"> Made emphatic by the suffix <hi rend="ital">pte</hi> or <hi rend="ital">met</hi> (ante-class. and late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">tuopte ingenio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tuopte consilio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scio te sponte non tuāpte errasse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tuismet litteris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 337</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n49559.5" n="B" level="2"> Pregn. </sense><sense id="n49559.6" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Your</hi>, <hi rend="ital">your own</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">favorable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">auspicious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proper</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suitable</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">right for you</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempore non tuo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:19:12" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 19, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec hora est tua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:19:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 19, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempore tuo pugnasti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:45:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 45, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque occasioni tuae desis neque suam occasionem hosti des,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:39:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 39, 21</bibl></cit> (v. suus).—</sense><sense id="n49559.7" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Your own</hi>, <hi rend="ital">your own master</hi>, <hi rend="ital">self-possessed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">compositus semperque tuus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:2:2:72" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 2, 2, 72</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:836" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Th. 4, 836</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 1, 12</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49559.8" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, for the <hi rend="ital">obj. gen.</hi> tui: <cit><quote lang="la">desiderio tuo,</quote> <trans><tr>through desire for you</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">odio tuo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 5, 8</bibl></cit> (9), 27: omnis gratas amicitias in tuā observantiā vincam, Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:24:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 24, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tuxtax: <entryFree id="n49560" type="main" key="tuxtax"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tuxtax</orth>, an exclamation imitative of the sound of blows: <sense id="n49560.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">tuxtax meo tergo erit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 2, 3, 12</bibl></cit>; cf. Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> 2, p. 185</bibl> P. (Com. Fragm. v. 6 Rib.), tax pax.</sense></entryFree>
tyana: <entryFree id="n49561" type="main" key="Ty^a^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tyăna</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*tu/ana</foreign>, <sense id="n49561.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city in Cappadocia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the birthplace of the philosopher Apollonius</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Kiz Hissar</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 3, 3, § 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 23, 6, 19</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tyă-nēĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Tyana</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">incola,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:719" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 719</bibl></cit>.—Collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tyănaeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 21, 14, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tyba: <entryFree id="n49562" type="main" key="Tyba"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tyba</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n49562.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a village on the Euphrates</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Taibe</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 15, 1, 2</bibl></sense></entryFree>
tybris: <entryFree id="n49563" type="main" key="Ty_bris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tȳbris</orth>, v. Tiberis.</entryFree>
tycha: <entryFree id="n49564" type="main" key="Ty^cha"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tycha</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*tu/xh</foreign> (fortuna), <sense id="n49564.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a part of Syracuse in the west of the Achradina</hi>, <hi rend="ital">called after the temple of the goddess</hi> <foreign lang="greek">*tu/xh</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:53:section=119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 53, § 119</bibl>; Liv 24, 21, 7; 25, 25, 5.</sense></entryFree>
tychius: <entryFree id="n49565" type="main" key="Ty^chi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tychĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*tuxi/os</foreign> (Hom. II. 7, 220), <sense id="n49565.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a celebrated shoemaker of Bœotia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:196" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 56, 57, § 196</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F 3, 824</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tydeus: <entryFree id="n49566" type="main" key="Ty_deus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tȳdeus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">dissyl.</orth>), <itype>ĕi and ĕos</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*tudeu/s</foreign>, <sense id="n49566.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the son of Œneus and Periboea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and father of Diomedes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:479" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 479</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:8:664" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 8, 664</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 69" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 69</bibl> and 70.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tȳdīdes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the son of Tydeus</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Diomedes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 97</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 471</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 164</bibl>; 2, 197; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 6, 16</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 15, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:622" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 622</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13, 68 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
tymolus: <entryFree id="n49567" type="main" key="Ty^mo_lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tymōlus</orth>, v. Tmolus.</entryFree>
tympaniolum: <entryFree id="n49568" type="hapax" key="tympa^ni^o^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tympănĭŏlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>tympanum</etym>, <sense id="n49568.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small drum</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a taboret</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tambourine</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
tympanista: <entryFree id="n49569" type="greek" key="tympa^nista"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tympănista</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">tumpanisth/s</foreign>, <sense id="n49569.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a drummer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">taborer</hi>, App. de Deo Socr. p 49, 19.</sense></entryFree>
tympanistria: <entryFree id="n49570" type="greek" key="tympa^nistri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tympănistrĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">tumpani/stria</foreign>, <sense id="n49570.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a female drummer</hi> or <hi rend="ital">player on the tambourine</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 1, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:67:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 67, 26</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2451</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tympanites: <entryFree id="n49571" type="greek" key="tympa^ni_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tympănītes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">tumpani/ths</foreign>, <sense id="n49571.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of dropsy that swells the belly like a drum</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tympanites</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 1, 43</bibl>; Cael. Aur Tard. 3, 8, 101 (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 21</bibl>, written as Greek).</sense></entryFree>
tympaniticus: <entryFree id="n49572" type="greek" key="tympa^ni_ti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tympănītĭcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">tumpanitiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n49572.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who is afflicted with tympanites</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a dropsical person</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 5, 24, § 60</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 3, 27</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tympanium: <entryFree id="n49573" type="greek" key="tympa^ni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tympănĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">tumpa/nion</foreign> <sense id="n49573.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a precious stone shaped like a tambourine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 35, 54, § 109</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:2:32:section=9" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 34, 2, 32, § 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tympanizans: <entryFree id="n49574" type="greek" key="tympa^ni_zans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tympănīzans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [<foreign lang="greek">tumpani/zw</foreign>], <sense id="n49574.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">playing on a drum</hi> or <hi rend="ital">timbrel</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:68" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 68 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
tympanotriba: <entryFree id="n49575" type="greek" key="tympa^no^tri^ba"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tympănŏtrĭba</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">tumpanotri/bhs</foreign>, <sense id="n49575.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a taborer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a timbrel-player</hi>, a term of reproach for a soft, effeminate person (alluding to the priests of Cybele), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:7:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 7, 49</bibl>; cf. tympanum.</sense></entryFree>
tympanum: <entryFree id="n49576" type="greek" key="tympa^num"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tympănum</orth>, <itype>i</itype> (collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">typă-num</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:63:8 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 63, 8 sq.</bibl>), <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">tu/mpanon</foreign>, <sense id="n49576.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a drum</hi>, <hi rend="ital">timbrel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tambour</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tambourine.</hi> </sense><sense id="n49576.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n49576.2" n="A" level="2"> Esp., as beaten by the priests of Cybele, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:618" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 618</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:63:8 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 63, 8 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:619" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 619</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:537" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 537</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 29</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 391</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:213" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 213</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:5:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 5, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3</bibl>, <cb n="TYPI" /> 105; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:11:20" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 11, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:14:10" default="NO">8, 14, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 5, 5</bibl>, —Also by the Bacchantine females, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 17</bibl>.—Beaten by the Parthians as a signal in battle in place of the tuba, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:2:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 41, 2, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49576.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a timbrel</hi>, etc., as a figure of something effeminate, enervating: <cit><quote lang="la">tympana eloquentiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:12:21" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 12, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in manu tympanum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 13:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 13, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49576.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of things of a like shape. </sense><sense id="n49576.5" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A drum</hi> or <hi rend="ital">wheel</hi>, in machines for raising weights, in water-organs, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:905" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 905</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:444" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 444</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:332" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 34, 77, § 332</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19:2:19" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 19, 2, 19</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49576.6" n="B" level="2"> In archit. </sense><sense id="n49576.7" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The triangular area of a pediment</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 3, 3 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n49576.8" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A panel</hi> of a door, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 4, 6 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n49576.9" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A part of the clepsydra</hi>, <hi rend="ital">called also</hi> phellos, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tyndareus: <entryFree id="n49577" type="main" key="Tynda^reus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tyndăreus</orth> (trisyl.; but quadrisyl. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:8:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 8, 31</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">17, 250</bibl>), ĕï (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Tyndărus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 77" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 77</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:78" default="NO">78</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 10, 11</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*tunda/reus</foreign>, <sense id="n49577.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a king of Sparta</hi>, <hi rend="ital">son of Œbalus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and husband of Leda; he was the father of Castor and Pollux</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and of Helen and Clytemnestra</hi>, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 496, 31</bibl>; Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 1325</bibl> P.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:15:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fat. 15, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:8:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 8, 31</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">17, 250</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 77" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 77</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:78" default="NO">78</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n49577.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tyndărĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Tyndareus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Tyndarian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fratres,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Castor and Pollux</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:570" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 570</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:167" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 167</bibl></cit> (al. Tyndareos as Gr. <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>, v. Tyndareus).—In <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tyndărĭi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <usg type="style">poet.</usg> for <hi rend="ital">Spartans</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:320" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 15, 320</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49577.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tyn-dărĭdes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a male descendant of Tyn dareus</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Castor</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Pollux;</hi> most freq. in <number>plur.</number> for both, Tyndaridae, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:86:352" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 86, 352</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:12:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 12, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:2:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 2, 6</bibl>; Ov F. 5, 700; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> M. 8, 301</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:8:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 8, 31</bibl>. —Also for <hi rend="ital">the children of Tyndareus</hi>, in gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">(Clytaemnestra) fortissima Tyndaridarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 100</bibl></cit>.—In <number>sing.</number>, of <hi rend="ital">Pollux</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:247" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 247</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:212" default="NO">6, 212</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49577.3" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tyndă-ris</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> </sense><sense id="n49577.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A female descendant of Tyndareus;</hi> of <hi rend="ital">Helen</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:464" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 464</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:473" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 473</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:601" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 601</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 569</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:32" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 32</bibl> (3, 30), 31; 3, 8 (4, 7), 30; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:746" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 746</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:233" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 15, 233</bibl>. Of <hi rend="ital">Clytemnestra</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:396" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 396</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:408" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 2, 408</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49577.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The name of a town on the north ern coast of Sicily</hi>, near the modern <hi rend="ital">Capo Tindaro</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 8, 14, § 90</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:206" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 92, 94, § 206</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Verr 2, 5, 49, § 128</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n49577.6" n="b" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tyn-dărĭtāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Tyndaris</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Verr 2, 2, 65, § 156</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Att 15, 2, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49577.7" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The name of a female friend of Horace</hi>, Hor C. 1, 17, 10.</sense></entryFree>
