typhoeus: <entryFree id="n49578" type="main" key="Ty^pho_eus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Typhōeus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">trisyl.</orth>), <itype>ĕos</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*tufweu/s</foreign>, <sense id="n49578.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a giant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">struck with lightning by Jupiter and buried under Mount Ætna</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:716" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 716</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:321 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 321 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:491" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 491</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:4:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 4, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:196 al" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 196 al.</bibl>—As a gigantic monster, called centimanus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:303" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 303</bibl>. —Hence, </sense><sense id="n49578.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Typhōĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Typhōeus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Typhœan</hi> tela, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:665" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 665</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cervix,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 3, 183</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49578.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Typhōïs</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj f.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of Typhōeus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Typhœan</hi>: Aetna, Ov H. 15, 11.</sense></entryFree>
typhon: <entryFree id="n49579" type="greek" key="ty_phon1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tȳphon</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">tufw/n</foreign>. <sense id="n49579.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A violent whirlwind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a typhoon</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 48, 49, § 131</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">App de Mundo, p. 64, 5.—The same accompanied by lightning,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:130" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 130</bibl></cit>. Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">tȳphōnĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventus,</quote> <trans><tr>a typhoon</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:27:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 27, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49579.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A name given by the king of Egypt to a comet</hi> or <hi rend="ital">meteor</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 25, 24, § 91</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n49580" type="main" key="Ty_pho_n2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tȳphōn</orth> (scanned Typhōn, Mart Cap. 2, 43), ōnis, <sense id="n49580.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">another name for the giart Typhōeus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:595" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 595</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:92" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 92</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F 2, 461</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 2, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 152" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 152</bibl>. Hence, </sense><sense id="n49580.1" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tȳphōnĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Typhon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Typhonian</hi>: specus, <hi rend="ital">the Typhon's cave</hi> in Cilicia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:13:4" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 13, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49580.2" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tȳphōnis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">daughter of Typhon</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Harpyiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:428" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 428</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
typhus: <entryFree id="n49581" type="greek" key="ty_phus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tȳphus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">tu=fos</foreign>, <sense id="n49581.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pride</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">inentis elatio et typhus qui appellatur a Graecis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 43</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 53</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 56</bibl>; 2, 63; 2, 88; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conf. 3:3" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Conf. 3, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:7:9" default="NO">7, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 5, § 566</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
typicalis: <entryFree id="n49582" type="main" key="ty^pi^ca_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">typĭcālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>typicus</etym>, <sense id="n49582.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">typical</hi> (late Lat.), Inc. Visit. Infirm. 2, 4.</sense></entryFree>
typicus: <entryFree id="n49583" type="greek" key="ty^pi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">typĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">tupiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n49583.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">figurative</hi>, <hi rend="ital">typical</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">typicus Moses (Christus),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sedul.</author> 3, 208</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cruor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 192</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49583.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Periodical</hi>, <hi rend="ital">recurring at intervals</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tremor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:15:95" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 15, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">accessiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tard. 3</bibl></cit>, S, 118. <pb n="1922" /> <cb n="TYRI" /></sense></entryFree>
typus: <entryFree id="n49584" type="greek" key="ty^pus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">typus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">tu/pos</foreign>. <sense id="n49584.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A figure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">image</hi>, on a wall, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 10, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 12, 43, § 151</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Heliog. 3</bibl> and 7.—</sense><sense id="n49584.1" n="II" level="1"> In medic. lang., <hi rend="ital">a form</hi>, <hi rend="ital">type</hi>, <hi rend="ital">character</hi> of intermittent fevers, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 1:14:108" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 1, 14, 108</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 102</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tyra: <entryFree id="n49585" type="main" key="Ty^ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tyra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. Tyras.</entryFree>
tyranna: <entryFree id="n49586" type="hapax" key="ty^ranna"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tyranna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <sense id="n49586.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">f</hi> [tyrannus], <hi rend="ital">a princess</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a female tyrant</hi> (with tyrannis), Treb. XXX. Tyr. 31 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
tyrannice: <entryFree id="n49587" type="main" key="ty^ranni^ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tyrannĭcē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. tyrannicus <sense id="n49587.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
tyrannicida: <entryFree id="n49588" type="main" key="ty^ranni^ci_da"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tyrannĭcīda</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>tyrannus-caedo</etym>, <sense id="n49588.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a killer of a tyrant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a tyrannicide</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 2:23:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 2, 23, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 23, 23, § 87</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 4</bibl>; id. Vit. Luc.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:36" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:59" default="NO">5, 10, 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:3:7" default="NO">7, 3, 7</bibl>; 7, 7, 2; 7, 7, 5; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 35</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tyrannicidium: <entryFree id="n49589" type="main" key="ty^ranni^ci_di^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tyrannĭcīdĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n49589.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the killing of a tyrant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tyrannicide</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 1:7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 1, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 72</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:3:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 3, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tyrannicus: <entryFree id="n49590" type="greek" key="ty^ranni^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tyrannĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">turanniko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n49590.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">tyrannous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tyrannical</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tetrum facinus, crudele, nefarium, tyrannicum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 30, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:15:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 15, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ira,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 1:11:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 1, 11, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crudelitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:16:4:11" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 16, 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dominatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:16:4:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 16, 4, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:5:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 21, 5, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regia et paene tyrannica facere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 6, 25</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">tyrannĭcē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">tyrannically</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea quae regie seu potius tyrannice statnit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:48:section=115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 48, § 115</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tyrannio: <entryFree id="n49591" type="main" key="Ty^ranni^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tyrannĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n49591.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a grammarian and geographer contemporary with Cicero</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 4, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 6, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 4</bibl>, b, 1; 4, 8, a, 2.</sense></entryFree>
tyrannis: <entryFree id="n49592" type="greek" key="ty^rannis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tyrannis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype> (<case>acc.</case> tyrannida, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 14, 2</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">turanni/s</foreign>. <sense id="n49592.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The sway of a tyrant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arbitrary</hi> or <hi rend="ital">despotic rule</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tyranny</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">o di boni! vivit tyrannis, tyrannus occidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 9, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sublato tyranno tyrannida manere video,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 14, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tyrannidem occupare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:23:90" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 23, 90</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:11:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 11, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">affectare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:2:54" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 2, 54</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:81" default="NO">9, 2, 81</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">delere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:22:52" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 22, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">destruere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:48" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 48</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:16:4:6" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 16, 4, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:5:11" default="NO">21, 5, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:10" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 10</bibl>, ext. 1; <cit><quote lang="la">8, 9, ext. 2: (Pythagoras) odio tyrannidis exsul Sponte erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tyrannis saeva crudaque Neronis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:223" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 223</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49592.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the region ruled by a tyrant</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quinque et viginti talenta tyrannidem tuam exhaurirent?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 14</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n49592.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A female tyrant</hi>, Treb. XXX. Tyr. 31 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; cf. tyranna.</sense></entryFree>
tyrannoctonus: <entryFree id="n49593" type="greek" key="ty^rannocto^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tyrannoctŏnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">turannokto/nos</foreign>, <sense id="n49593.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the killer of a tyrant</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostri tyrannoctoni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 15, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">16, 15, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tyrannopolita: <entryFree id="n49594" type="greek" key="tyranno^po^li_ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tyrannŏpŏlīta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">turannopoli/ths</foreign>, <sense id="n49594.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a citizen of a town ruled by a tyrant</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 5, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tyrannus: <entryFree id="n49595" type="greek" key="ty^rannus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tyrannus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">tu/rannos</foreign>. <sense id="n49595.0" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a monarch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ruler</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sovereign</hi>, <hi rend="ital">king</hi> (rare, and mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">tyrannusque fuerat appellatus (Miltiades), sed justus ... omnes autem et dicuntur et habentur tyranni, qui potestate sunt perpetuā in eā civitate, quae libertate usa est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 8, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:320" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 320</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 266</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:436" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 436</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 581</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:227" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 227</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:388" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 388</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:548" default="NO">5, 548</bibl>.—Of the Spartan king Nabis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:12:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 12, 7</bibl>.—Of Neptune, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:276" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 276</bibl>.—Of Pluto, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:508" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 508</bibl>.—Of the constellation Capricornus, because it ruled over, influenced the ocean, Hor C. 2, 17, 19.—</sense><sense id="n49595.1" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a cruel</hi> or <hi rend="ital">severe ruler</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a despot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tyrant</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tyrannorum vita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:15:52" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 15, 52</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:8:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 13, 8, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:9:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Vatin. 9, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">importunus atque amens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:40:section=103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 40, § 103</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:13:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 13, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:20:57" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 20, 57</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum exitiabilis tyrannus (urbem) vi atque armis oppressit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:17:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 17, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tyrannorum ingeniis mors est remedium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 7:20:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 7, 20, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:7:3" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 7, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:1:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:492" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 492</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 58</bibl>: animus noster modo rex est. modo tyrannus; <cit><quote lang="la">ubi impotens, cupidus, delicatus est, transit in nomen detestabile ac dirum, et fit tyrannus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 114:24" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 114, 24</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Gen. plur.</hi>: tyrannūm novi temeritudinem, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 181, 23</bibl> (Trag. Rel. p. 79 Rib.: non tyrannum novi, as <hi rend="ital">acc. sing.</hi>).</sense></entryFree>
tyras: <entryFree id="n49596" type="main" key="Ty^ras"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tyras</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*tu/ras</foreign>, <sense id="n49596.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river in Sarmatia</hi>, now the <hi rend="ital">Dniester</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:1:7" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 1, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:10:50" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 10, 50</bibl>.—Called also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tyra</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:12:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 26</bibl>. § 82.</sense></entryFree>
tyrianthinus: <entryFree id="n49597" type="greek" key="ty^ri^anthi^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tyrĭanthĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">turia/nqinos</foreign>, <sense id="n49597.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of a cotor between purple and violet</hi>: pallium. <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Carin. 19</bibl>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">tyrĭ-anthina</orth>, ōrum. <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">garments of a purpleviolet color</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:54:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 54, 5</bibl>. <cb n="TYRU" /></sense></entryFree>
tyrius: <entryFree id="n49598" type="main" key="Ty_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tȳrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Tyrus.</entryFree>
tyro: <entryFree id="n49599" type="main" key="Ty_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tȳro</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*turw/</foreign>, <sense id="n49599.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a daughter of Salmoneus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:28:51" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 28, 51</bibl> (3, 26, 5); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 60" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 60</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:254" default="NO">254</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tyropatina: <entryFree id="n49600" type="greek" key="ty_ro^pa^ti^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tȳrŏpătĭna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>vox hibrida from <foreign lang="greek">turo/s</foreign>, cheese, and patina</etym>, <sense id="n49600.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of cheesecake</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:7:11" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 7, 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
tyros: <entryFree id="n49601" type="main" key="Ty_ro^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tȳrŏs</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. Tyrus.</entryFree>
tyrotarichos: <entryFree id="n49602" type="greek" key="ty_ro^ta^ri_cho^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tȳrŏtărīchŏs</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">turota/rixos</foreign>, <sense id="n49602.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a dish of salt-fish prepared with cheese</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:16:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 16, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, 16, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 8</bibl>, a, 1; 14, 16, 1.—<hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">patella tyrotaricha,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:4:2" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 4, 2 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
tyrrheni: <entryFree id="n49603" type="main" key="Tyrrhe_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tyrrhēni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*turrhnoi/</foreign>, <sense id="n49603.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Tyrrhenians</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a Pelasgian people who migrated to Italy and formed the parent stock of the Etrurians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 171</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 733</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 8, § 50</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n49603.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tyrrhē-nus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Tyrrhenians</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Etrurians</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Tyrrhenian</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Etrurian</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Tuscan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:3:3" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 3, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 10, § 75</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:11:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 11, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 24, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aequor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 15, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 67</bibl>.—Also personified: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tyrrhēnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the Tuscan Sea</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:715" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 715</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">flumen,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the Tiber</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:663" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 663</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 647</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:576" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 576</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:555" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 555</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regum progenies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:29:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 29, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 10, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of Tyrrhenians</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sigilla,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 180</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, for <hi rend="ital">Italian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pubes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:111" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 111</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49603.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tyr-rhēnĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the country of the Tyrrhenians</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Tyrrhenia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Etruria</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:452" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 452</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n49603.3" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tyrrhēnĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Tyrrhenians</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Etruscans</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Tyrrhenian</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Etrurian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tarraco,</quote> <trans><tr>situated on the Tuscan Sea</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 24, 88</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:42" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 42</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tyrrheus: <entryFree id="n49604" type="main" key="Tyrrheus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tyrrheus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">dissyl.</orth>), <itype>ĕi</itype>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tyrrhus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n49604.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the shepherd of King Latinus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:485" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 485</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tyrrhīdae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the sons of Tyrrheus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:484" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 484</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tyrtaeus: <entryFree id="n49605" type="main" key="Tyrtaeus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tyrtaeus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*turtai=os</foreign>, <sense id="n49605.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an Athenian poet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who flourished about</hi> 680 B.C., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:402" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 402</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:5" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 3, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tyrus: <entryFree id="n49606" type="main" key="Ty^rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tyrus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-ŏs</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*tu/ros</foreign> (Heb. <foreign />). <sense id="n49606.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">Tyre</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a famous mariiime and commercial city of the Phœnicians</hi>, <hi rend="ital">especially celebrated for its purple</hi>, now the ruins of <hi rend="ital">Soor</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:12:2" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 12, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 19, 17, § 76</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:2 sq" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 2 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:16:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 16, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:56:section=145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 56, § 145</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:7:20" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 7, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:13" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 13</bibl> (4, 12), 7; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:346" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 346</bibl>; Cv. M. 3, 539; 15, 288.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tyrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> </sense><sense id="n49606.1" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Tyre</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Tyrian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">purpura,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 29, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">murex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 170</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:166" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 11, 166</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fucus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:6:222" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 222</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">colores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:9:340" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 340</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 6, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 4, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">chlamys,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">merces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:29:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 29, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puella,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Europa</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:605" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 605</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">also called Tyria paelex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:258" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 3, 258</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">taurus (that carried her),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:51:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 51, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tyria maria in proverbium deductum est, quod Tyro oriundi Poeni adeo potentes maris fuerunt, ut omnibus mortalibus navigatio esset periculosa. Afranius in Epistula: hunc in servum autem maria Tyria conciet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=355" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 355</bibl></cit> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n49606.2" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, for <hi rend="ital">Theban</hi> (because Thebes was founded by the Phœnician, Cadmus): <cit><quote lang="la">montes,</quote> <trans><tr>in the neighborhood of Thebes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:10" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">12, 693</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">agri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 406</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ductor,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Eteocles</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 205</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exsul,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Polynices</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 406</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plectrum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of Amphion</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:1:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> S. 3, 1, 16</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">chelys,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:8:232" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Th. 8, 232</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49606.3" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Carthaginian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">arces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virgines,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 336</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbs,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 388</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">doli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:268" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 268</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ductor,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Hannibal</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:171" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 171</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">miles,</quote> <trans><tr>the army of Hannibal</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 13</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n49606.4" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Purple</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of a purple color</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">torus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:2:75" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 2, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:9:70" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 9, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:7:47" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 7, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">palla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:2:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 2, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subtemen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:1:121" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 1, 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amictus, Ov A. A. 2, 297: cocco tinctum Tyrio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 41, 65, § 140</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ty-rĭum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a purple color</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tyria atque conchylia et omnis alios colores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 2, 3, § 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:45" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 6, 26, § 45</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tyrĭi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Tyre</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Tyrians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:6:1" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 3, 6, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:13:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 11, 13, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 13, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:108 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 108 al.</bibl>—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, transf. (cf. supra), for <hi rend="ital">Thebans</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:10" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 73</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, 489</bibl>.—For <hi rend="ital">Carthaginians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:574" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 574</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 111</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:82 al" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 82 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n49606.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">purple</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:29:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 29, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:11:7" default="NO">6, 11, 7</bibl>. <cb n="UBER" /> <cb n="U." /></sense></entryFree>
u: <entryFree id="n49607" type="main" key="U"><orth extent="full" lang="la">U</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">u</orth> (orig. V, v, a modification of the Greek <foreign lang="greek">*U</foreign>, Marc. Vict. p. 2459 P.), the twentieth letter of the Latin alphabet (<sense id="n49607.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">i</hi> and <hi rend="ital">j</hi> being counted as one), a vowel, which was early distinguished by the old grammarians from the consonant V, though represented by the same sign; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> the letter <ref targOrder="U">V</ref></xr>. The long <hi rend="ital">u</hi> corresponded in sound to the Greek <foreign lang="greek">ou</foreign>, and to the German and Italian <hi rend="ital">u</hi> (Engl. <hi rend="ital">oo</hi>); the short <hi rend="ital">u</hi> seems to have been an obscure sound resembling the German <hi rend="ital">ü</hi> and the French <hi rend="ital">u;</hi> hence <hi rend="ital">ŭ</hi> sometimes represented the Greek <foreign lang="greek">u</foreign>, as in fuga from <foreign lang="greek">fugh/</foreign>, cuminum from <foreign lang="greek">ku/minon</foreign>, etc.; and sometimes was exchanged with the Latin <hi rend="ital">i</hi>, as in opt<hi rend="ital">i</hi>mus and opt<hi rend="ital">u</hi>mus, carn<hi rend="ital">u</hi>fex and carn<hi rend="ital">i</hi>fex, sat<hi rend="ital">u</hi>ra and sat<hi rend="ital">i</hi>ra, in the old inscriptions CAP<hi rend="ital">V</hi>TALIS and NOMIN<hi rend="ital">V</hi>S LATINI, in the emperor Augustus's pronunciation of s<hi rend="ital">i</hi>mus for s<hi rend="ital">u</hi>mus, etc.; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> the letter <ref targOrder="U">I</ref></xr>. For the affinity of <hi rend="ital">u</hi> with <hi rend="ital">o</hi> and with <hi rend="ital">v</hi>, v. under those letters. U inserted in Alcumena, Alcumaeo, Æsculapius, Tecumessa, drachuma al.; v. Ritschl in Rhein. Mus. Neue Folge, 8, p. 475 sq.; 9, p. 480; and cf. the letters A and O.—As an abbreviation, V. (as the sign of the vowel <hi rend="ital">u</hi>) stands for uti, so V. V. uti voverant; and especially for urbs (i. e. Roma); as, U. C. (urbis conditae), or A. U. C. (ab urbe conditā). For its meanings when used as a sign of the consonant V, v. under the letter V <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
uber: <entryFree id="n49608" type="main" key="u_ber1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūber</orth>, <itype>ĕris</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ou)=qar</foreign>; Sanscr. ūdhar; cf. O. H. Germ. uter; Engl. udder; cf. the letter B</etym>, <sense id="n49608.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a teat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pap</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dug</hi>, <hi rend="ital">udder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a breast that gives suck</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n49608.1" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:887" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 887</bibl>: lactantes ubere toto, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 103</bibl> P. (Ann. v. 71 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">(vitula) binos alit ubere fetus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut vix sustineant distentum cruribus uber,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:826" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 826</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vituio ab ubere rapto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:459" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 459</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum a nutricis ubere auferretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49608.2" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi> (so most freq.): <cit><quote lang="la">saepe etiam nunc (puer) Ubera mammarum in somnis lactantia quaeret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:885" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 885</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lactea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:524" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 524</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capreoli Bina die siccant ovis ubera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:2:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> E. 2, 42</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ad sua quisque fere decurrunt ubera lactis (agni),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:370" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 370</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lactis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:3:46" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 3, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mammarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:1:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">candens lacteus umor Uberibus manat distentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:259" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 259</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">distenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:2:46" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 2, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equina,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 16, 50</bibl></cit>: natos uberibus gravidis vitali rore rigabat, Cic. poët. Div. 1, 12, 20; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">(Romulus) cum esset silvestris beluae sustentatus uberibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uberaque ebiberant avidi lactantia nati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:342" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 342</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sua quemque mater uberibus alit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 20</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n49608.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n49608.4" n="A" level="2"> Of the earth, <hi rend="ital">the fruitful breast</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">alma tellus annuā vice mortalibus distenta musto demittit ubera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:21:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 21, 3</bibl></cit>: ubera campi, id. poët. 10, 90. —</sense><sense id="n49608.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A cluster</hi> or <hi rend="ital">mass in the shape of an udder</hi>, of bees hanging from trees when swarming, <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Jun. 7, 6</bibl> and 9.—</sense><sense id="n49608.6" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Richness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fruitfulness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fertility</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quique frequens herbis et fertilis ubere campus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:185" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 185</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">divitis agri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:262" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 7, 262</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">glebae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 531</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in denso non segnior ubere Bacchus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:275" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 2, 275</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pecorique et vitibus almis Aptius uber erit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 234</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:27:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 27, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">palmitis Etrusci,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> B. G. 504</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n49609" type="main" key="u_ber2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūber</orth>, <itype>ĕris</itype> (<case>abl.</case> uberi; <sense id="n49609.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">but ubere campo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:27:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 27, 1</bibl></cit>), <hi rend="ital">adj</hi> [1. uber; cf. ibid. II. C.], <hi rend="ital">rich</hi> in something, <hi rend="ital">full</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fruitful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fertile</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abundant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plentiful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">copious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">productive</hi> (class.; syn.: ferax, fertilis, fecundus). </sense><sense id="n49609.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">seges spicis uberibus et crebris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:30:91" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 30, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">messis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 2, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fruges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:15:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 15, 5</bibl></cit>: itaque res uber fuit, antequam vastassent regiones, Cato ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 647</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">Umbria me genuit terris fertilis uberibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:22:10" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 22, 10</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in uberi agro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:25:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 25, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uber solum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 5, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Neptunus) Piscatu novo me uberi compotivit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">onus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:2:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 2, 64</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:27" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 27</bibl>: bellum, <hi rend="ital">productive</hi> in booty, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:7:9" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 38, 7, 9</bibl>: gravis imber et uber. <hi rend="ital">copious</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:290" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 290</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">guttae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:349" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 349</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aqua prolluens et uber,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rivi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:19:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 19, 10</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: agro bene culte nihil potest esse nec usu uberius nec specie<pb n="1923" /> <cb n="UBER" />  ornatius, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:16:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 16, 57</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque enim robustior aetas Ulla nec uberior (aestate),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:208" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 208</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subtemen,</quote> <trans><tr>fuller</tr>, <tr>stouter</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 3, 1, 20</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">uberrimi laetissimique fructus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:62:156" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 62, 156</bibl></cit>.— With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbor ibi niveis uberrima pomis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Sulmo) gelidis uberrimus undis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:10:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 4, 10, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uberrimus quaestus,</quote> <trans><tr>the most profitable</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 2, 22</bibl></cit>: equum nimis strigosum et male habitum, sed equitem ejus uberrimum et habitissimum viderunt, <hi rend="ital">exceedingly stout</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plump</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">fat</hi>, Massur. Sabin. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:20:11" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 20, 11</bibl>.— With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">regio cum aeris ac plumbi uberrima, tum et minio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:44:3:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 44, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: frugum, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 498, 6</bibl>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">teneant uberrima Teucer Et Libys,</quote> <trans><tr>the most fruitful regions</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:510" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 510</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49609.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">full</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rich</hi>, <hi rend="ital">copious</hi>, esp. of style and language: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc Periclem praestitisse ceteris dicit oratoribus Socrates, quod is Anaxagorae physici fuerit auditor, a quo censet eum uberem et fecundum fuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:4:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">motus animi, qui ad explicandum ornandumque sint uberes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:25:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 25, 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">theses ad excitationem dicendi mire speciosae atque uberes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:24" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 4, 24</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullus feracior in eā (philosophiā) locus est nec uberior quam de officiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:2:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 2, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:3:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 3, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aut majore delectatione aut spe uberiore commoveri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 4, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis uberior in dicendo Platone?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:31:121" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 31, 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uberiores litterae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:50:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 13, 50, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Catoni seni comparatus C. Gracchus plenior et uberior,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec Africanus Petreiusque pleniora etiam atque uberiora Romam ad suos perscribant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tuasque Ingenio laudes uberiore canunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:74" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in juvenibus etiam uberiora paulo et paene periclitantia feruntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:32" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 32</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">doctissimi homines ingeniis uberrimis adfluentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:15:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 15, 57</bibl></cit> (dub.; <cit><quote lang="la">bracketed by B. and K.): uberrima supplicationibus triumphisque provincia,</quote> <trans><tr>full of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:40:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 40, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uberrimae litterae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:16:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 16, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec decet te ornatum uberrimis artibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:97:332" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 97, 332</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratorum eā aetate uberrimus erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 31 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>, used only in the <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi> </sense><sense id="n49609.3" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">more fruitfully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">more fully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">more copiously</hi> or <hi rend="ital">plentifully</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">uberius nulli provenit ista seges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:2:12" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flere uberius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:31:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 31, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mores mali quasi herba irrigua succreverunt uberrime,</quote> <trans><tr>most luxuriantly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 1, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49609.4" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of style, etc., <hi rend="ital">copiously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fully</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 3, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec cum uberius disputantur et fusius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:7:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 7, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loqui (with planius),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicere (with latius),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:17:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 17, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">explicare (with latius),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Rhet. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locus uberrime tractatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:1:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 1, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
uberius: <entryFree id="n49610" type="main" key="u_be^ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūbĕrĭus</orth>, <sense id="n49610.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">comp. adv.; sup.</hi> <orth extent="full" lang="la">ūberrĭme</orth>, v. 2. uber <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
ubero: <entryFree id="n49611" type="main" key="u_be^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūbĕro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>2. uber</etym>. * <sense id="n49611.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be fruitful</hi> or <hi rend="ital">productive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to bear fruit</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque enim olea continuo biennio uberat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:9:11" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 9, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49611.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to make fruitful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to fertilize</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc velut coitu steriles arbores uberantur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Oct. 8, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Febr. 17, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ubertas: <entryFree id="n49612" type="main" key="u_bertas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūbertas</orth> (on coins also VBERITAS; v. Rasche, Lex. Rei Num. V. 2, p. 759), <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n49612.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">richness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fulness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plenteousness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plenty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abundance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">copiousness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fruitfulness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fertility</hi>, <hi rend="ital">productiveness</hi> (class.; syn.: fecunditas, copia). </sense><sense id="n49612.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">mammarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:51:128" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 51, 128</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Asia ubertate agrorum ... facile omnibus terris antecellat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 6, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amnium fontiumque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 6, § 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubertas in percipiendis fructibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:98:section=227" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 98, § 227</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frugum et fructuum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:36:68" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 36, 68</bibl></cit>; cf.: rami bacarum ubertate incurvescere, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:28:69" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 28, 69</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vini (opp. frumenti inopia),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pabuli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:201" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 13, 77, § 201</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lactis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 22, 39, § 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">piscium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:18:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 18, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praedae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:25:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 25, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:412" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 15, 412</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49612.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n49612.3" n="A" level="2"> Of mind, character, etc., <hi rend="ital">richness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fulness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubertates et copiae virtutis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:66:167" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 66, 167</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenii,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> post Red. in Sen. 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,032:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Marcell. 2, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">immortalis ingenii ubertas beatissima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:109" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 109</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Fug. Saec. 8, 48</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">utilitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:44:195" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 44, 195</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49612.4" n="B" level="2"> Of style or language, <hi rend="ital">copiousness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fulness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubertas in dicendo et copia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:12:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 12, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubertas et quasi silva dicendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:3:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 3, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa Livii lactea ubertas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:32" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10</bibl></cit>, <cb n="UBI" /> 1, 13; 10, 1, 109; <cit><quote lang="la">12, 2, 23: oratoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 3, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:1:24" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 1, 24</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ubertim: <entryFree id="n49613" type="main" key="u_bertim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūbertim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>2. uber</etym>, <sense id="n49613.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">plentifully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abundantly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">copiously</hi> (mostly post-Aug.; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic.): ubertim lacrimulas fundere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:66:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 66, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:81" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 81</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tit. 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 4:25" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 4, 25</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 134</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, p. 161</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Laud. Seren. 214</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
uberto: <entryFree id="n49614" type="main" key="u_berto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūberto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>2. uber; cf. ubero</etym>, <sense id="n49614.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make fruitful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to fertilize</hi> (post-Aug. and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">ut omnes simul terras ubertet foveatque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:32:2" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 32, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agros (imber),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Eum.</author> Grat. Act. ad Const. 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
ubi: <entryFree id="n49615" type="main" key="u^bi_^"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŭbī^</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>for quo-bi; cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">pou=, po/-qi</foreign>; Ion. <foreign lang="greek">ko/-qi</foreign></etym>. <sense id="n49615.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n49615.1" n="A" level="2"> A relative local particle, denoting rest in a place, <hi rend="ital">in which place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in what place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">where.</hi> </sense><sense id="n49615.2" n="1" level="3"> With corresp. <hi rend="ital">ibi</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in eam partem ituros atque ibi futuros Helvetios, ubi eos Caesar constituisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">velim, ibi malis esse, ubi aliquo numero sis, quam istic, ubi solus sapere videare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 10</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nemo sit, quin ubivis, quam ibi, ubi est, esse malit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ergo, ubi tyrannus est, ibi ... dicendum est plane nullam esse rem publicam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:31:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 3, 31, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ibi unde huc translata essent, atque ubi primum exstitissent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 16, 30</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49615.3" n="2" level="3"> Referring to other expressions of place: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes, qui tum eos agros, ubi hodie est haec urbs, incolebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:2:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non modo ut Spartae, rapere ubi pueri et clepere discunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in ipso aditu atque ore portus, ubi, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:12:section=30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 12, § 30</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49615.4" n="3" level="3"> With the interrogative particle <hi rend="ital">nam</hi> suffixed: <cit><quote lang="la">in quā non video, ubinam mens constans possit insistere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:10:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 10, 24</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49615.5" n="4" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">terrarum</hi>, <hi rend="ital">loci</hi> (v. terra and locus): <cit><quote lang="la">non edepol nunc, ubi terrarum sim, scio, si quis roget,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 180</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid ageres, ubi terrarum esses,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:10:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 10, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi loci fortunae tuae sint, facile intellegis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:5:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 5, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut inanis mens quaerat, ubi sit loci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 24, 24, § 90</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49615.6" n="5" level="3"> Repeated ubi ubi, also written as one word ubiubi, <hi rend="ital">wherever</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wheresoever</hi> = ubicumque (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">ubi ubi est, fac, quamprimum haec audiat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:8:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 8, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sperantes facile, ubiubi essent se ... conversuros aciem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:57:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 57, 12</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">gentium</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi ubi est gentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 2, 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49615.7" n="B" level="2"> In a direct interrogation, <hi rend="ital">where? So.</hi> Ubi patera nunc est? <hi rend="ital">Me.</hi> In cistulā, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:264" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 264</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi ego perii? ubi immutatus sum? ubi ego formam perdidi?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 300</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi inveniam Pamphilum? Ubi quaeram?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 2, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi sunt, qui Antonium Graece negant scire?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:14:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 14, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">heu! ubi nunc fastus altaque verba jacent?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:4:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 4, 150</bibl></cit> Ruhnk.—</sense><sense id="n49615.8" n="2" level="3"> Esp., with <hi rend="ital">gentium</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi illum quaeram gentium?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:5:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 5, 2, 13</bibl></cit>; and with the interrog. particle <hi rend="ital">nam</hi> suffixed: <cit><quote lang="la">ubinam est is homo gentium?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:3:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 2, 3, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">o di immortales! ubinam gentium sumus? ... in quā urbe vivimus?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 4, 9</bibl></cit> (v. gens).— </sense><sense id="n49615.9" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n49615.10" n="A" level="2"> Most freq. of time, <hi rend="ital">when</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whenever</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as soon as</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi summus imperator non adest ad exercitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi ego Sosia nolim esse, tu esto sane Sosia. Nunc. etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1, 284</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi friget, huc evasit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi lucet, magistratus myrrhā unguentisque unguentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=87" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 87</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut sol, victis ubi nubibus exit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:571" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 571</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qualis, ubi hibernam Lyciam Xanthique fluenta Deserit (Apollo),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 143</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi semel quis pejeraverit, ei credi postea non oportet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:13:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Post. 13, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc ubi Amphitruo erus conspicatu'st meus, Ilico, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi de ejus adventu Helvetii certiores facti sunt, legatos ad eum mittunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi ea dies venit, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem ubi vidi, equidem vim lacrimarum profudi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:14:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 14, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi galli cantum audivit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:27:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 27, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">at hostes, ubi primum nostros equites conspexerunt ... impetu facto, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 1, 6</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:6:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 6, 41</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">inf. hist.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 51</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n49615.11" n="2" level="3"> With correl. <pos>adv.</pos> of time (mostly anteand post-class.; not in Cic. or Caæs.). </sense><sense id="n49615.12" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">tum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">otium ubi erit, tum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 4, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi convivae abierint, tum venias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:4:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 4, 2, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 4, 7, 18</bibl>; Quadrig. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:2:13" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 2, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cetera maleficia tum persequare, ubi facta sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 52:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 52, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 33, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">33, 45</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: ubi conticuerit recte tumultus, tum in curiam patres<cb n="UBIQ" />  revocandos esse, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:55:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 55, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:38:4" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 38, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes">43, 5, 6</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">44, 34, 5: ut, cum admissa et perpetrata fuerint, tum denique, ubi, quae facta sunt infecta fieri non possunt, puniantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6</bibl></cit> (7), 3, 42.—Esp., with <hi rend="ital">tum demum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi jam caro increscit, tum demum et balineis raris utendum erit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:27" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:8:16" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 8, 16</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49615.13" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">tunc</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi vis acrior imminet hostium, tunc, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 1, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tunc est consummata infelicitas. ubi, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 39:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 39, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:89:15" default="NO">89, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:89:19" default="NO">89, 19</bibl>.—Esp., with <hi rend="ital">tunc demum</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49615.14" n="B" level="2"> In colloq. lang., referring to things or persons, instead of the relative pronoun, <hi rend="ital">in which</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by which</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with which</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wherewith</hi>, etc.; or of persons, <hi rend="ital">with whom</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by whom</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">ne illi sit cera, ubi facere possit litteras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:4:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 4, 1, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hujusmodi res semper comminiscere, Ubi me excarnifices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 6, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum multa colligeres et ex legibus et ex senatusconsultis, ubi, si verba, non rem sequeremur, confici nihil posset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:57:243" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 57, 243</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si rem servassem, fuit, ubi negotiosus essem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 1, 2, 38</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">est, ubi id isto modo valeat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:8:23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 8, 23</bibl></cit>; v. sum, I. B. 5. b. <foreign lang="greek">b</foreign>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque nobis adhuc praeter te quisquam fuit, ubi nostrum jus contra illos obtineremus,</quote> <trans><tr>with whom</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 9, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Alcmene, questus ubi ponat aniles, Iolen habet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:276" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 276</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ubicumque: <entryFree id="n49616" type="main" key="u^bi_^cumque"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŭbī^-cumque</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">-cunque</orth>, old Lat. <orth extent="full" lang="la">-quomque</orth>: <sense id="n49616.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">in tmesi: istius hominis ubi fit quomque mentio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 2, 3, 18</bibl></cit>), <pos>adv.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">wherever</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wheresoever.</hi> </sense><sense id="n49616.1" n="I" level="1"> Relative: <cit><quote lang="la">ubicumque est lepidum unguentum, ungor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">etsi, ubicumque es, in eādem es navi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego uni Servor, ubīcumque est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:735" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 735</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sis licet felix, ubicumque mavis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:27:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 27, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">des operam, ut te ante Calendas Januarias, ubicumque erimus, sistas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 3, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubicumque eris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:17:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 17, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:126" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 126</bibl>: <hi rend="ital">De.</hi> Si quid te volam, ubi eris? <hi rend="ital">Li.</hi> Ubicumque libitum fuerit animo meo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:1:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 1, 97</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">terrarum</hi>, <hi rend="ital">locorum</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gentium</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui ubicumque terrarum sunt, ibi, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:44:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 44, 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubicumque locorum Vivitis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 3, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubicumque erit gentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:44:121" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N.
